To insure cleanliness Saudi banned iftar inside mosques ahead of Ramadan:

#Saudi Arabia’s Prince, #mohammadbinsalman, issued an order banning #Iftars in #mosques ahead of Ramadan, tentatively slated to begin on March 11 and conclude by April 9 this year.
Saudi Arabia’s Ministry of #Islamic Affairs issued a set of instructions for mosque employees to follow during the month of Ramadan in an order dated February 20, 2024. The Ministry also issued orders restricting imams and muezzins from collecting financial #donations for organising iftar feasts. The Islamic Affairs Ministry of Saudi Arabia also imposed a ban on organising iftar feasts inside the mosques, raising concerns regarding cleanliness.

In a post on X (formerly Twitter), the caption to the notice read, “The #Ministry_of_Islamic_Affairs, Dawah and Guidance issues a number of instructions related to mosques during the blessed month of #Ramadan 1445 AH.”

The order stated, “Imams and muezzins in various regions of the Kingdom not to collect financial donations for Iftar projects for fasting people and others.”

The notice, raising issues about #cleanliness being compromised when iftar feasts are held inside mosques, directed imam and muezzin to oversee the organisation of these feasts in mosques’ courtyards and charged them with the responsibility to ensure cleanliness soon after the feast concludes.

The Ministry’s notice stated, “Iftar projects should not be held inside mosques due to concerns about cleanliness, so an appropriate place should be prepared in the mosques’ courtyards without the use of temporary rooms, tents, or the like, and that Iftar should be under the imam’s and muezzin’s responsibility, with the obligation of the one who breaks the fast to clean the place immediately after finishing food.”

Moreover, the Ministry discouraged using cameras inside the mosque premises, stating that they should not be used to record the imam and worshippers offering namaz, as this undermines worshippers’ reverence. The Ministry also issued orders that prayers should not be broadcast on media of any kind, including social media.

Week 190: 02/06/24: This week we @food_fuelforfaith gave away sanitary pads to the female workers in and around our society. 

“Menstrual hygiene is a necessity, not a luxury”.

Talking about menstruation is a taboo in most societies, and this contributes to the ignorance and illiteracy on menstrual hygiene management. Economic status, socio-cultural beliefs and lack of sufficient menstrual awareness are contributors to the lower prevalence of women using sanitary napkins for periods. Taking care of yourself during menstruation is as important as taking care of your day to day activities. A little negligence in menstrual hygiene management can cause your body grievous harm, and you may also act as an instrument for the spread of infection to others. Please spread a word for us @vediika__ @mau.urya @niyomishah__ and make this grow. Thank you all for the support🙏

Another amazing milestone has been reached by South West Blood Bikes in 2024, over 40,000 items have been collected, transported and delivered by our fantastic, dedicated  volunteers, who give so much of their time to help others in the communities they live and work in!

These items have all been transported on behalf of the NHS and other Medical Facilities in Devon since the charity began in 2018, all completely FREE of charge! The items range from whole blood, blood & other biological samples, patient notes, medication, medical equipment and even donor breast milk for premature babies.

We do not receive any funding from the NHS or its patients for this service, it is run entirely on the generous donations from the general public, community groups, local businesses, volunteer fundraising and some grant funding. Every penny donated goes towards keeping the charity operational. Everyone in the charity is a VOLUNTEER and we have NO paid staff.

Please help us continue to be able to provide this service for many years to come an by using the donate link below. Please remember to tick the Gift Aid box if you are eligible, every penny really does make a difference.

Thank you ❤

In an act of love befitting Valentine’s Day, local philanthropists @garymhess and @trevor.burgess.94 have made a $1 million gift to the @st.petersburgfreeclinic, and now they’re challenging the community to match the donation.

Today, the St. Petersburg Free Clinic announced the Burgess-Hess million-dollar gift and challenge that will help provide vital support for the important work of SPFC. The Free Clinic’s wide-reaching work in Pinellas County provides health care, nutritious food, recovery housing, and education for our neighbors in need. With this gift, Burgess and Hess are asking locals to match the charitable support so that SPFC can continue and build upon its crucial work.

As SPFC notes, the need for support in St. Pete and Pinellas County has actually increased by more than 50% over the last few years as so many individuals and families in the area struggle to keep up with the soaring cost of living. 

Full story for #ilovetheburg by Bob Carskadon at the link in our bio.

Today is one year since my baby Thistle passed. Rest in peace sweet Thistle. I have not posted on here but I have also been working as a vet tech. Because of you Thistle I started another career helping animals, and I think of this often. Thank you for our short time together and for propelling me into a field I love. Hopefully in the future there will be successful treatments for FIP, its a devastating diagnosis and agonizing to go through. I donated again to The Winn Feline Foundation who funds a bunch of FIP research. Love you little Thistle ❤️ #fuckfip #felineinfectiousperitonitisawareness  #felineinfectiousperitonitis #winnfelinefoundation #fipresearch #endfip

It’s Lacy’s 3 year cure date from FIP. I’m grateful everyday that I have this silly, sassy, snuggle bug in my life. I almost lost her to a horrible disease that we now have the meds for. But the meds are expensive and black market because the fda hasn’t approved it. And because it’s not fda approved, most vets don’t know about the cure, and if they do they can’t recommend the illegal cure for fear of losing their license. Research is still underway and @zenbycat is helping. I would love if the drugs could be made available to everyone that need them. I would also love if there could be a vaccine one day. Please check out @zenbycat and think about becoming a monthly donor to help with the research ❤️🐾🐾 #fipsucks #fipsurvivor #curedoffip #formerferal #fipwarrior #fipresearch #rescuecat

This isn't a fun post to make. In fact, it really sucks. 

If you have been following us since the beginning, you may remember Jupiter. She was a tiny little kitten with deformed front legs that almost froze to death. One of our founders, Mallori, fought HARD to keep her alive for those touch-and-go first 24 hours. After she was stable, she was transferred to Abby, one of our board members with immense veterinary knowledge. At Abby's home, Jupiter was LOVED immensely and became Abby and Family's first "foster fail". Unfortunately, Jupiter had medical problem after medical problem. The decision was ultimately made to let her go peacefully from her suffering. Jupiter's family opted for a necropsy, which is the same thing as an autopsy in humans. Upon examination, doctors were able to determine that Jupiter was suffering from the dry form of FIP. 

We are wanting to compile data to benefit FIP research, starting with our own kitties. If you have previously adopted from us and your cat was diagnosed or suspected to have FIP, please fill out the form located in the LinkTr.ee in our bio called "FIP Data Collection". If you have a cat that was diagnosed with or suspected to have FIP that was not adopted from us, you are also welcome to complete the form. We know that this form may be triggering and difficult to complete, so we thank you WHOLEHEARTEDLY in advance. 

You can learn a lot more about FIP by visiting the LinkTr.ee in our bio and clicking the "Learn More about FIP" link.

Feline infectious peritonitis (FIP) is a viral disease caused by a feline coronavirus that affects wild and domestic cats. This type of coronavirus is different from the coronavirus that causes COVID-19 in people.

Feline coronavirus is very common and usually doesn't cause any serious issues, aside from mild diarrhea. But when the feline coronavirus changes to a specific strain of the coronavirus, FIP can develop. In about 10% of infected cats, the virus will multiply and mutate, resulting in an infection known as feline infectious peritonitis virus (FIPV) that spreads throughout the cat’s body. It can cause an extreme inflammatory reaction in the tissues surrounding the abdomen, kidney, or brain.

[FIP Questionnaire] 🐱🐾 [FIP 問卷]

如你懷疑你的貓患上 FIP，或在治療中，請在連結登入及上載資料，當數量足夠時，系統會嘗試以現有的數據作病情及藥效分析，此調查不能取代臨床檢查，請按時回獸醫覆診。（連結在簡介中）

If you suspect that your cat has or is undergoing treatment for FIP, please log in to the provided link and upload the necessary information. When there is a sufficient amount of data, the system will attempt to analyze the condition and efficacy of the medication based on existing information. However, this survey cannot replace clinical examinations. Please make sure to schedule regular follow-up appointments with your veterinarian. (Link in bio)

Together, we strive for a healthier world for our feline friends.

𝐍𝐞𝐰 𝐃𝐫𝐮𝐠𝐬 𝐆𝐢𝐯𝐞 𝐚 𝐌𝐢𝐝𝐝𝐥𝐞 𝐂𝐥𝐚𝐰 𝐭𝐨 𝐅𝐞𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐞 𝐈𝐧𝐟𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐮𝐬 𝐏𝐞𝐫𝐢𝐭𝐨𝐧𝐢𝐭𝐢𝐬 (𝐅𝐈𝐏)

 𝗔𝗨𝗦𝗧𝗥𝗔𝗟𝗜𝗔 (Medical) Until recently, FIP was a death sentence for cats. A kitty diagnosed with FIP faced a swift introduction to the Grim Reaper.
Fortunately, 𝒘𝒂𝒔 is now the operative word cuz studies show two new drugs, GS-441524 and remdesivir (known for treating COVID-19), cure over 85% of my fellow felines with FIP.

𝗞𝗲𝘆 𝘀𝘁𝘂𝗱𝘆 𝘁𝗮𝗸𝗲𝗮𝘄𝗮𝘆𝘀:
•	Both GS-441524 and remdesivir are effective and well-tolerated in FIP kitties with a cure rate of 86% at 6 months. Woohoo!
•	Both oral and injectable forms of these drugs are effective.
•	The researchers are still trying to determine the optimal dosages and durations of treatment for FIP. (More on that when they finally figure out the math.)
•	The drugs aren't approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration, so there are legal and ethical issues with using them before vets get the FDA's okey dokey.

𝗢𝗻 𝗮 𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗼𝗻𝗮𝗹 𝗻𝗼𝘁𝗲
 My house companion Pallas died of FIP last year. After it was too late for her, I found a source of the meds: https://maxpawhealth.com/ (No endorsement; just offering a resource.)

𝗥𝗲𝗮𝗱 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗦𝘁𝘂𝗱𝘆
J Vet Intern Med. 2023 Sep-Oct;37(5):1772-1783. doi: 10.1111/jvim.16803. Epub 2023 Jul 13. https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/37439383

Today, I come with sad news. My heart is shattered as I share that my baby has been diagnosed positive for FIP (Feline Infectious Peritonitis). I’ve created a fundraising link for those willing to help. It will be pinned in my bio. The treatment is illegal so, really expensive but offers a chance for survival. This is the only chance. Any contribution means a lot to me... and I’m so sorry for having to post here.
And also, perhaps some of you have gone through the same ordeal and could help me with the steps to follow for treatment or share your experiences.

He has wet FIP with severe symptoms, including abdominal effusion and jaundice. He sleeps a lot, barely moves, and can’t meow. Fluid fills his internal cavities, requiring urgent action. A treatment, albeit illegal and expensive (between 2500 and 8000+ €), may help him survive. We’re facing challenging costs too for daily injections, weekly vet visits, blood tests, and ultrasounds. 

I can’t let my baby go; any support, no matter how small, is deeply appreciated. My other cat, Tokyo, carries the disease dormant, and we hope he remains unaffected. Praying for my bb Kaiju’s recovery.
 
You will live. I love you ❤️‍🩹😢🧸

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) received nearly 90% of all corporate donations in the financial year 2022-23, a report by Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR) revealed ahead of the Supreme Court’s verdict declaring the electoral bond scheme as unconstitutional today.

According to the election watchdog’s report, while other national political parties reported a combined corporate donation of nearly Rs 70 crore, the BJP received Rs 610.491 crore from the sector.

ADR’s report also highlighted the total donations declared by the national parties for 2022-23, a total of Rs 850.438 crore, of which Rs 719.858 crore went to the BJP alone.

The total donations declared by the BJP are five times more than the total donations declared by Congress, Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), Communist Party of India or CPI(M) and National People’s Party (NPP) for the same period, the report said.

The ADR report is based on donations above Rs 20,000, received by the national political parties during the financial year 2022-23, as per details submitted by the parties to the Election Commission of India (EC).

Read more at thewire.in

CWC Year 4 Fellow Khloe @khloe_taylor_thompson is attending CCA’s pre-college program @cacollegeofarts this summer in San Francisco!

Since she was just 8 years old, Khloe has been captivated by the world of fashion design. Fueled by her grandmother’s exceptional sewing skills, Khloe’s passion for creating clothes blossomed. 

“As an artist, I’m inspired by anything. Anything I see can make me want to create an illustration. I love creating dresses, even sketching a dress you can make shapes and change the overall look of how it will appear on the body. I think the illusion of garments is what I totally love.”

Khloe founded a nonprofit organization (Khloe Kares) supporting women experiencing homelessness. She is passionate about philanthropy having raised funds to build water pumps in Ghanaian schools without access to clean water.

Inspired by artists who merge different eras, such as Michael Wilkinson, the costume designer for “Jingle Jangle,” Khloe is fascinated by the fusion of Afro-Victorian styles with contemporary patterns and colors. She draws inspiration from African fashion, embracing its vibrant patterns and cultural significance.
 
Please read our blog post highlighting Khloe and the other fellows attending CCA pre-college this summer.

So excited to be running both of these marathons this year. It’s going to be incredible. 

Chicago will be my 2nd ever full marathon and I’m so excited to be running BOTH with Children’s Tumor Foundation. 

Not only do I run with them because I have NF2-SWN, but because their goal is to help for research to find a cure for ALL types of NF!

Thank you!

Mystical Shaman Oracle by:
Alberto Villoldo
Colette Baron-Reid
Marcela Lobos

✨The Giveaway✨

THE ESSENCE
The Giveaway is the gift you offer to life, without attachment, without expecting anything back. You can only give what is truly yours: a smile, a nod of encouragement, a gentle touch, and a kind word. This is not giving to others what you no longer want, like the sweater that no longer fits, but gifting that which is most precious-your authentic love and genuine feelings.

THE INVITATION
Make a list of 10 people and things for which you are grateful. Connect with the feeling of gratitude. The giveaway comes to ask you to feel the same gratitude without needing anything or anyone to inspire it, and to share this gratitude with those you meet.

As you offer thanks, your heart opens and you start realizing how much life has given you. You heal your feelings of scarcity and open yourself to the abundance that surrounds you. The giveaway invites you to be in the flow of life, as you give freely and receive freely.

THE MEDICINE
Is it difficult for you to set limits on how much of yourself you give? If you give more than is healthy, then you will not be able to give for long.

You’ll feel resentful with your partner or associates, or you’ll feel like the world owes you something in return.
Notice if you give for any reason other than pure generosity. Are you trying to be liked or accepted? Are you hoping to heal an old wound?

Start giving to yourself first and foremost. Offer yourself the care, the love, the time, and the acceptance that you are longing for. Once you experience plenty, then you can truly give to others.

To insure cleanliness Saudi banned iftar inside mosques ahead of Ramadan:

#Saudi Arabia’s Prince, #mohammadbinsalman, issued an order banning #Iftars in #mosques ahead of Ramadan, tentatively slated to begin on March 11 and conclude by April 9 this year.
Saudi Arabia’s Ministry of #Islamic Affairs issued a set of instructions for mosque employees to follow during the month of Ramadan in an order dated February 20, 2024. The Ministry also issued orders restricting imams and muezzins from collecting financial #donations for organising iftar feasts. The Islamic Affairs Ministry of Saudi Arabia also imposed a ban on organising iftar feasts inside the mosques, raising concerns regarding cleanliness.

In a post on X (formerly Twitter), the caption to the notice read, “The #Ministry_of_Islamic_Affairs, Dawah and Guidance issues a number of instructions related to mosques during the blessed month of #Ramadan 1445 AH.”

The order stated, “Imams and muezzins in various regions of the Kingdom not to collect financial donations for Iftar projects for fasting people and others.”

The notice, raising issues about #cleanliness being compromised when iftar feasts are held inside mosques, directed imam and muezzin to oversee the organisation of these feasts in mosques’ courtyards and charged them with the responsibility to ensure cleanliness soon after the feast concludes.

The Ministry’s notice stated, “Iftar projects should not be held inside mosques due to concerns about cleanliness, so an appropriate place should be prepared in the mosques’ courtyards without the use of temporary rooms, tents, or the like, and that Iftar should be under the imam’s and muezzin’s responsibility, with the obligation of the one who breaks the fast to clean the place immediately after finishing food.”

Moreover, the Ministry discouraged using cameras inside the mosque premises, stating that they should not be used to record the imam and worshippers offering namaz, as this undermines worshippers’ reverence. The Ministry also issued orders that prayers should not be broadcast on media of any kind, including social media.

Week 190: 02/06/24: This week we @food_fuelforfaith gave away sanitary pads to the female workers in and around our society. 

“Menstrual hygiene is a necessity, not a luxury”.

Talking about menstruation is a taboo in most societies, and this contributes to the ignorance and illiteracy on menstrual hygiene management. Economic status, socio-cultural beliefs and lack of sufficient menstrual awareness are contributors to the lower prevalence of women using sanitary napkins for periods. Taking care of yourself during menstruation is as important as taking care of your day to day activities. A little negligence in menstrual hygiene management can cause your body grievous harm, and you may also act as an instrument for the spread of infection to others. Please spread a word for us @vediika__ @mau.urya @niyomishah__ and make this grow. Thank you all for the support🙏

Another amazing milestone has been reached by South West Blood Bikes in 2024, over 40,000 items have been collected, transported and delivered by our fantastic, dedicated  volunteers, who give so much of their time to help others in the communities they live and work in!

These items have all been transported on behalf of the NHS and other Medical Facilities in Devon since the charity began in 2018, all completely FREE of charge! The items range from whole blood, blood & other biological samples, patient notes, medication, medical equipment and even donor breast milk for premature babies.

We do not receive any funding from the NHS or its patients for this service, it is run entirely on the generous donations from the general public, community groups, local businesses, volunteer fundraising and some grant funding. Every penny donated goes towards keeping the charity operational. Everyone in the charity is a VOLUNTEER and we have NO paid staff.

Please help us continue to be able to provide this service for many years to come an by using the donate link below. Please remember to tick the Gift Aid box if you are eligible, every penny really does make a difference.

Thank you ❤

In an act of love befitting Valentine’s Day, local philanthropists @garymhess and @trevor.burgess.94 have made a $1 million gift to the @st.petersburgfreeclinic, and now they’re challenging the community to match the donation.

Today, the St. Petersburg Free Clinic announced the Burgess-Hess million-dollar gift and challenge that will help provide vital support for the important work of SPFC. The Free Clinic’s wide-reaching work in Pinellas County provides health care, nutritious food, recovery housing, and education for our neighbors in need. With this gift, Burgess and Hess are asking locals to match the charitable support so that SPFC can continue and build upon its crucial work.

As SPFC notes, the need for support in St. Pete and Pinellas County has actually increased by more than 50% over the last few years as so many individuals and families in the area struggle to keep up with the soaring cost of living. 

Full story for #ilovetheburg by Bob Carskadon at the link in our bio.

Today is one year since my baby Thistle passed. Rest in peace sweet Thistle. I have not posted on here but I have also been working as a vet tech. Because of you Thistle I started another career helping animals, and I think of this often. Thank you for our short time together and for propelling me into a field I love. Hopefully in the future there will be successful treatments for FIP, its a devastating diagnosis and agonizing to go through. I donated again to The Winn Feline Foundation who funds a bunch of FIP research. Love you little Thistle ❤️ #fuckfip #felineinfectiousperitonitisawareness  #felineinfectiousperitonitis #winnfelinefoundation #fipresearch #endfip

It’s Lacy’s 3 year cure date from FIP. I’m grateful everyday that I have this silly, sassy, snuggle bug in my life. I almost lost her to a horrible disease that we now have the meds for. But the meds are expensive and black market because the fda hasn’t approved it. And because it’s not fda approved, most vets don’t know about the cure, and if they do they can’t recommend the illegal cure for fear of losing their license. Research is still underway and @zenbycat is helping. I would love if the drugs could be made available to everyone that need them. I would also love if there could be a vaccine one day. Please check out @zenbycat and think about becoming a monthly donor to help with the research ❤️🐾🐾 #fipsucks #fipsurvivor #curedoffip #formerferal #fipwarrior #fipresearch #rescuecat

This isn't a fun post to make. In fact, it really sucks. 

If you have been following us since the beginning, you may remember Jupiter. She was a tiny little kitten with deformed front legs that almost froze to death. One of our founders, Mallori, fought HARD to keep her alive for those touch-and-go first 24 hours. After she was stable, she was transferred to Abby, one of our board members with immense veterinary knowledge. At Abby's home, Jupiter was LOVED immensely and became Abby and Family's first "foster fail". Unfortunately, Jupiter had medical problem after medical problem. The decision was ultimately made to let her go peacefully from her suffering. Jupiter's family opted for a necropsy, which is the same thing as an autopsy in humans. Upon examination, doctors were able to determine that Jupiter was suffering from the dry form of FIP. 

We are wanting to compile data to benefit FIP research, starting with our own kitties. If you have previously adopted from us and your cat was diagnosed or suspected to have FIP, please fill out the form located in the LinkTr.ee in our bio called "FIP Data Collection". If you have a cat that was diagnosed with or suspected to have FIP that was not adopted from us, you are also welcome to complete the form. We know that this form may be triggering and difficult to complete, so we thank you WHOLEHEARTEDLY in advance. 

You can learn a lot more about FIP by visiting the LinkTr.ee in our bio and clicking the "Learn More about FIP" link.

Feline infectious peritonitis (FIP) is a viral disease caused by a feline coronavirus that affects wild and domestic cats. This type of coronavirus is different from the coronavirus that causes COVID-19 in people.

Feline coronavirus is very common and usually doesn't cause any serious issues, aside from mild diarrhea. But when the feline coronavirus changes to a specific strain of the coronavirus, FIP can develop. In about 10% of infected cats, the virus will multiply and mutate, resulting in an infection known as feline infectious peritonitis virus (FIPV) that spreads throughout the cat’s body. It can cause an extreme inflammatory reaction in the tissues surrounding the abdomen, kidney, or brain.

[FIP Questionnaire] 🐱🐾 [FIP 問卷]

如你懷疑你的貓患上 FIP，或在治療中，請在連結登入及上載資料，當數量足夠時，系統會嘗試以現有的數據作病情及藥效分析，此調查不能取代臨床檢查，請按時回獸醫覆診。（連結在簡介中）

If you suspect that your cat has or is undergoing treatment for FIP, please log in to the provided link and upload the necessary information. When there is a sufficient amount of data, the system will attempt to analyze the condition and efficacy of the medication based on existing information. However, this survey cannot replace clinical examinations. Please make sure to schedule regular follow-up appointments with your veterinarian. (Link in bio)

𝐍𝐞𝐰 𝐃𝐫𝐮𝐠𝐬 𝐆𝐢𝐯𝐞 𝐚 𝐌𝐢𝐝𝐝𝐥𝐞 𝐂𝐥𝐚𝐰 𝐭𝐨 𝐅𝐞𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐞 𝐈𝐧𝐟𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐮𝐬 𝐏𝐞𝐫𝐢𝐭𝐨𝐧𝐢𝐭𝐢𝐬 (𝐅𝐈𝐏)

 𝗔𝗨𝗦𝗧𝗥𝗔𝗟𝗜𝗔 (Medical) Until recently, FIP was a death sentence for cats. A kitty diagnosed with FIP faced a swift introduction to the Grim Reaper.
Fortunately, 𝒘𝒂𝒔 is now the operative word cuz studies show two new drugs, GS-441524 and remdesivir (known for treating COVID-19), cure over 85% of my fellow felines with FIP.

𝗞𝗲𝘆 𝘀𝘁𝘂𝗱𝘆 𝘁𝗮𝗸𝗲𝗮𝘄𝗮𝘆𝘀:
•	Both GS-441524 and remdesivir are effective and well-tolerated in FIP kitties with a cure rate of 86% at 6 months. Woohoo!
•	Both oral and injectable forms of these drugs are effective.
•	The researchers are still trying to determine the optimal dosages and durations of treatment for FIP. (More on that when they finally figure out the math.)
•	The drugs aren't approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration, so there are legal and ethical issues with using them before vets get the FDA's okey dokey.

𝗢𝗻 𝗮 𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗼𝗻𝗮𝗹 𝗻𝗼𝘁𝗲
 My house companion Pallas died of FIP last year. After it was too late for her, I found a source of the meds: https://maxpawhealth.com/ (No endorsement; just offering a resource.)

𝗥𝗲𝗮𝗱 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗦𝘁𝘂𝗱𝘆
J Vet Intern Med. 2023 Sep-Oct;37(5):1772-1783. doi: 10.1111/jvim.16803. Epub 2023 Jul 13. https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/37439383

Today, I come with sad news. My heart is shattered as I share that my baby has been diagnosed positive for FIP (Feline Infectious Peritonitis). I’ve created a fundraising link for those willing to help. It will be pinned in my bio. The treatment is illegal so, really expensive but offers a chance for survival. This is the only chance. Any contribution means a lot to me... and I’m so sorry for having to post here.
And also, perhaps some of you have gone through the same ordeal and could help me with the steps to follow for treatment or share your experiences.

He has wet FIP with severe symptoms, including abdominal effusion and jaundice. He sleeps a lot, barely moves, and can’t meow. Fluid fills his internal cavities, requiring urgent action. A treatment, albeit illegal and expensive (between 2500 and 8000+ €), may help him survive. We’re facing challenging costs too for daily injections, weekly vet visits, blood tests, and ultrasounds. 

I can’t let my baby go; any support, no matter how small, is deeply appreciated. My other cat, Tokyo, carries the disease dormant, and we hope he remains unaffected. Praying for my bb Kaiju’s recovery.
 
You will live. I love you ❤️‍🩹😢🧸

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) received nearly 90% of all corporate donations in the financial year 2022-23, a report by Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR) revealed ahead of the Supreme Court’s verdict declaring the electoral bond scheme as unconstitutional today.

According to the election watchdog’s report, while other national political parties reported a combined corporate donation of nearly Rs 70 crore, the BJP received Rs 610.491 crore from the sector.

ADR’s report also highlighted the total donations declared by the national parties for 2022-23, a total of Rs 850.438 crore, of which Rs 719.858 crore went to the BJP alone.

The total donations declared by the BJP are five times more than the total donations declared by Congress, Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), Communist Party of India or CPI(M) and National People’s Party (NPP) for the same period, the report said.

The ADR report is based on donations above Rs 20,000, received by the national political parties during the financial year 2022-23, as per details submitted by the parties to the Election Commission of India (EC).

Read more at thewire.in

For nearly a year, Al Otro Lado, in collaboration with other organizations, mutual aid groups and selfless volunteers have been providing critical humanitarian relief to refugees at the open-air detention sites in Eastern San Diego County. They are being held by Border Patrol without food, water, shelter or medical assistance. We will continue this work for as long as this takes, but we can’t do it without you! 

This Saturday, we will be hosting a donation drive to support the hundreds of refugees trapped at these sites. By donating essential items, you can make a significant difference in the lives of those in need!  

Date: Saturday, June 1st

Location: Balboa Park, 6th Ave and Balboa Drive, San Diego

CWC Year 4 Fellow Khloe @khloe_taylor_thompson is attending CCA’s pre-college program @cacollegeofarts this summer in San Francisco!

Since she was just 8 years old, Khloe has been captivated by the world of fashion design. Fueled by her grandmother’s exceptional sewing skills, Khloe’s passion for creating clothes blossomed. 

“As an artist, I’m inspired by anything. Anything I see can make me want to create an illustration. I love creating dresses, even sketching a dress you can make shapes and change the overall look of how it will appear on the body. I think the illusion of garments is what I totally love.”

Khloe founded a nonprofit organization (Khloe Kares) supporting women experiencing homelessness. She is passionate about philanthropy having raised funds to build water pumps in Ghanaian schools without access to clean water.

Inspired by artists who merge different eras, such as Michael Wilkinson, the costume designer for “Jingle Jangle,” Khloe is fascinated by the fusion of Afro-Victorian styles with contemporary patterns and colors. She draws inspiration from African fashion, embracing its vibrant patterns and cultural significance.
 
Please read our blog post highlighting Khloe and the other fellows attending CCA pre-college this summer.

Can’t believe I can start counting down in weeks! Sooner than you think I’ll be counting down in days… 

So excited to be running both of these marathons this year. It’s going to be incredible. 

Chicago will be my 2nd ever full marathon and I’m so excited to be running BOTH with Children’s Tumor Foundation. 

Not only do I run with them because I have NF2-SWN, but because their goal is to help for research to find a cure for ALL types of NF!

With this cure, no one else would have to wonder when their next surgery is, what the next treatment is going to be, when will a new side effect pop up… No one deserves that. 

And that’s why I run. I’m looking to raise $5,000 towards this goal. I’m just a little over halfway there. It would be so greatly appreciated if you could find it in your hearts to donate and support this cause 💙💚

Thank you!

✨The Giveaway✨

THE ESSENCE
The Giveaway is the gift you offer to life, without attachment, without expecting anything back. You can only give what is truly yours: a smile, a nod of encouragement, a gentle touch, and a kind word. This is not giving to others what you no longer want, like the sweater that no longer fits, but gifting that which is most precious-your authentic love and genuine feelings.

THE INVITATION
Make a list of 10 people and things for which you are grateful. Connect with the feeling of gratitude. The giveaway comes to ask you to feel the same gratitude without needing anything or anyone to inspire it, and to share this gratitude with those you meet.

As you offer thanks, your heart opens and you start realizing how much life has given you. You heal your feelings of scarcity and open yourself to the abundance that surrounds you. The giveaway invites you to be in the flow of life, as you give freely and receive freely.

THE MEDICINE
Is it difficult for you to set limits on how much of yourself you give? If you give more than is healthy, then you will not be able to give for long.

You’ll feel resentful with your partner or associates, or you’ll feel like the world owes you something in return.
Notice if you give for any reason other than pure generosity. Are you trying to be liked or accepted? Are you hoping to heal an old wound?

Start giving to yourself first and foremost. Offer yourself the care, the love, the time, and the acceptance that you are longing for. Once you experience plenty, then you can truly give to others.

To insure cleanliness Saudi banned iftar inside mosques ahead of Ramadan:

#Saudi Arabia’s Prince, #mohammadbinsalman, issued an order banning #Iftars in #mosques ahead of Ramadan, tentatively slated to begin on March 11 and conclude by April 9 this year.
Saudi Arabia’s Ministry of #Islamic Affairs issued a set of instructions for mosque employees to follow during the month of Ramadan in an order dated February 20, 2024. The Ministry also issued orders restricting imams and muezzins from collecting financial #donations for organising iftar feasts. The Islamic Affairs Ministry of Saudi Arabia also imposed a ban on organising iftar feasts inside the mosques, raising concerns regarding cleanliness.

In a post on X (formerly Twitter), the caption to the notice read, “The #Ministry_of_Islamic_Affairs, Dawah and Guidance issues a number of instructions related to mosques during the blessed month of #Ramadan 1445 AH.”

The order stated, “Imams and muezzins in various regions of the Kingdom not to collect financial donations for Iftar projects for fasting people and others.”

The notice, raising issues about #cleanliness being compromised when iftar feasts are held inside mosques, directed imam and muezzin to oversee the organisation of these feasts in mosques’ courtyards and charged them with the responsibility to ensure cleanliness soon after the feast concludes.

The Ministry’s notice stated, “Iftar projects should not be held inside mosques due to concerns about cleanliness, so an appropriate place should be prepared in the mosques’ courtyards without the use of temporary rooms, tents, or the like, and that Iftar should be under the imam’s and muezzin’s responsibility, with the obligation of the one who breaks the fast to clean the place immediately after finishing food.”

Moreover, the Ministry discouraged using cameras inside the mosque premises, stating that they should not be used to record the imam and worshippers offering namaz, as this undermines worshippers’ reverence. The Ministry also issued orders that prayers should not be broadcast on media of any kind, including social media.

Week 190: 02/06/24: This week we @food_fuelforfaith gave away sanitary pads to the female workers in and around our society. 

“Menstrual hygiene is a necessity, not a luxury”.

Talking about menstruation is a taboo in most societies, and this contributes to the ignorance and illiteracy on menstrual hygiene management. Economic status, socio-cultural beliefs and lack of sufficient menstrual awareness are contributors to the lower prevalence of women using sanitary napkins for periods. Taking care of yourself during menstruation is as important as taking care of your day to day activities. A little negligence in menstrual hygiene management can cause your body grievous harm, and you may also act as an instrument for the spread of infection to others. Please spread a word for us @vediika__ @mau.urya @niyomishah__ and make this grow. Thank you all for the support🙏

Another amazing milestone has been reached by South West Blood Bikes in 2024, over 40,000 items have been collected, transported and delivered by our fantastic, dedicated  volunteers, who give so much of their time to help others in the communities they live and work in!

These items have all been transported on behalf of the NHS and other Medical Facilities in Devon since the charity began in 2018, all completely FREE of charge! The items range from whole blood, blood & other biological samples, patient notes, medication, medical equipment and even donor breast milk for premature babies.

We do not receive any funding from the NHS or its patients for this service, it is run entirely on the generous donations from the general public, community groups, local businesses, volunteer fundraising and some grant funding. Every penny donated goes towards keeping the charity operational. Everyone in the charity is a VOLUNTEER and we have NO paid staff.

Please help us continue to be able to provide this service for many years to come an by using the donate link below. Please remember to tick the Gift Aid box if you are eligible, every penny really does make a difference.

Thank you ❤

In an act of love befitting Valentine’s Day, local philanthropists @garymhess and @trevor.burgess.94 have made a $1 million gift to the @st.petersburgfreeclinic, and now they’re challenging the community to match the donation.

Today, the St. Petersburg Free Clinic announced the Burgess-Hess million-dollar gift and challenge that will help provide vital support for the important work of SPFC. The Free Clinic’s wide-reaching work in Pinellas County provides health care, nutritious food, recovery housing, and education for our neighbors in need. With this gift, Burgess and Hess are asking locals to match the charitable support so that SPFC can continue and build upon its crucial work.

As SPFC notes, the need for support in St. Pete and Pinellas County has actually increased by more than 50% over the last few years as so many individuals and families in the area struggle to keep up with the soaring cost of living. 

Full story for #ilovetheburg by Bob Carskadon at the link in our bio.

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) received nearly 90% of all corporate donations in the financial year 2022-23, a report by Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR) revealed ahead of the Supreme Court’s verdict declaring the electoral bond scheme as unconstitutional today.

According to the election watchdog’s report, while other national political parties reported a combined corporate donation of nearly Rs 70 crore, the BJP received Rs 610.491 crore from the sector.

ADR’s report also highlighted the total donations declared by the national parties for 2022-23, a total of Rs 850.438 crore, of which Rs 719.858 crore went to the BJP alone.

The total donations declared by the BJP are five times more than the total donations declared by Congress, Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), Communist Party of India or CPI(M) and National People’s Party (NPP) for the same period, the report said.

The ADR report is based on donations above Rs 20,000, received by the national political parties during the financial year 2022-23, as per details submitted by the parties to the Election Commission of India (EC).

Read more at thewire.in

For nearly a year, Al Otro Lado, in collaboration with other organizations, mutual aid groups and selfless volunteers have been providing critical humanitarian relief to refugees at the open-air detention sites in Eastern San Diego County. They are being held by Border Patrol without food, water, shelter or medical assistance. We will continue this work for as long as this takes, but we can’t do it without you! 

This Saturday, we will be hosting a donation drive to support the hundreds of refugees trapped at these sites. By donating essential items, you can make a significant difference in the lives of those in need!

Location: Balboa Park, 6th Ave and Balboa Drive, San Diego

So excited to be running both of these marathons this year. It’s going to be incredible. 

Chicago will be my 2nd ever full marathon and I’m so excited to be running BOTH with Children’s Tumor Foundation. 

Not only do I run with them because I have NF2-SWN, but because their goal is to help for research to find a cure for ALL types of NF!

With this cure, no one else would have to wonder when their next surgery is, what the next treatment is going to be, when will a new side effect pop up… No one deserves that. 

And that’s why I run. I’m looking to raise $5,000 towards this goal. I’m just a little over halfway there. It would be so greatly appreciated if you could find it in your hearts to donate and support this cause 💙💚

Thank you!

Pupdate!
Garet now Garret was a puppy who showed up and never left! He actually started out as a foster for Susan and Des, but we know how that happens, right? Sweet Garret is actually the right hand dog for Susan and Des when they open their home to foster more puppies. Garret is a little over a year old now, and his job around the house is to show foster puppies the ropes because he has developed his own skills at Sunday training with Susan. He loves daddy Des, and enjoys hanging out with him in his man cave. Garret has also had houseguest, Jack, to keep company over the last couple of months. Jack will be leaving Des and Susan’s home soon, and returning to his own family. We love seeing Garret’s daily life in Des and Susan’s home. It’s heartwarming!
Happy life, Garret!

To insure cleanliness Saudi banned iftar inside mosques ahead of Ramadan:

#Saudi Arabia’s Prince, #mohammadbinsalman, issued an order banning #Iftars in #mosques ahead of Ramadan, tentatively slated to begin on March 11 and conclude by April 9 this year.
Saudi Arabia’s Ministry of #Islamic Affairs issued a set of instructions for mosque employees to follow during the month of Ramadan in an order dated February 20, 2024. The Ministry also issued orders restricting imams and muezzins from collecting financial #donations for organising iftar feasts. The Islamic Affairs Ministry of Saudi Arabia also imposed a ban on organising iftar feasts inside the mosques, raising concerns regarding cleanliness.

In a post on X (formerly Twitter), the caption to the notice read, “The #Ministry_of_Islamic_Affairs, Dawah and Guidance issues a number of instructions related to mosques during the blessed month of #Ramadan 1445 AH.”

The order stated, “Imams and muezzins in various regions of the Kingdom not to collect financial donations for Iftar projects for fasting people and others.”

The notice, raising issues about #cleanliness being compromised when iftar feasts are held inside mosques, directed imam and muezzin to oversee the organisation of these feasts in mosques’ courtyards and charged them with the responsibility to ensure cleanliness soon after the feast concludes.

The Ministry’s notice stated, “Iftar projects should not be held inside mosques due to concerns about cleanliness, so an appropriate place should be prepared in the mosques’ courtyards without the use of temporary rooms, tents, or the like, and that Iftar should be under the imam’s and muezzin’s responsibility, with the obligation of the one who breaks the fast to clean the place immediately after finishing food.”

Moreover, the Ministry discouraged using cameras inside the mosque premises, stating that they should not be used to record the imam and worshippers offering namaz, as this undermines worshippers’ reverence. The Ministry also issued orders that prayers should not be broadcast on media of any kind, including social media.

We will be posting everyday updates to the opening of our show to raise awareness and support for this family and will be sharing our donation information through this process. Week 190: 02/06/24: This week we @food_fuelforfaith gave away sanitary pads to the female workers in and around our society. 

“Menstrual hygiene is a necessity, not a luxury”.

Talking about menstruation is a taboo in most societies, and this contributes to the ignorance and illiteracy on menstrual hygiene management. Economic status, socio-cultural beliefs and lack of sufficient menstrual awareness are contributors to the lower prevalence of women using sanitary napkins for periods. Taking care of yourself during menstruation is as important as taking care of your day to day activities. A little negligence in menstrual hygiene management can cause your body grievous harm, and you may also act as an instrument for the spread of infection to others. Please spread a word for us @vediika__ @mau.urya @niyomishah__ and make this grow. Thank you all for the support🙏

#HELPNEEDED - Sam (left in photo) is a friend of mine who badly needs an operation. 

Please see the #gofundme link below:
https://www.gofundme.com/f/sam-needs-help-for-an-operation

Like me, Sam has hypermobile #EhlersDanlosSyndrome (EDS). However, Sam also has a rare condition called Tethered Cord, where the spinal cord (which should float free) becomes attached in the lumbar spine, causing global symptoms. These include, but are not limited to, severe leg weakness, muscle pulling, bladder issues and neck instability. This condition is much more common in people with #symptomatichypermobility and #EDS
 
Sam has been unwell for quite some time now. Up until a few years ago her symptoms were manageable and she was functional, but they got worse.
 
In November 2023, Sam had an initial operation in the UK with a spinal surgeon which brought lots of improvements. Unfortunately, after a few months Sam's symptoms returned, most likely due to scar tissue, or inflammation that wasn't properly controlled after the surgery.

Sam now desperately needs to get to Barcelona's #TeknonMedicalCentre or #RhodeIslandHospital in the US to access an operation with experts in this very niche area.

Finances for Sam and her family have grown increasingly difficult - the NHS doesn’t do the operation, and whilst she managed to get health insurance to pay for 50% of the first operation, it won’t cover further surgery.

The actual cost is around £40k, so we're doing our best to raise a decent proportion of this amount. If we can raise more than our target, that would be fantastic.

We know that asking people for money is Sam's worst nightmare (other than not being able to move from her bed), so we are doing this on her behalf. 

Before she became ill, Sam was a freelance writer and music nerd - a life that she would very much like to get back to!

The photo shown is from several years ago, visiting the National History Museum with Zach - Sam's favourite small person.

We're grateful for whatever you're able to contribute. Or, if you can't but know someone who might, please #share this. Thank you! :)

#sedsconnective #bendybodies #EDS #hypermobility #tetheredcord #tetheredcordsyndrome

In an act of love befitting Valentine’s Day, local philanthropists @garymhess and @trevor.burgess.94 have made a $1 million gift to the @st.petersburgfreeclinic, and now they’re challenging the community to match the donation.

Today, the St. Petersburg Free Clinic announced the Burgess-Hess million-dollar gift and challenge that will help provide vital support for the important work of SPFC. The Free Clinic’s wide-reaching work in Pinellas County provides health care, nutritious food, recovery housing, and education for our neighbors in need. With this gift, Burgess and Hess are asking locals to match the charitable support so that SPFC can continue and build upon its crucial work.

As SPFC notes, the need for support in St. Pete and Pinellas County has actually increased by more than 50% over the last few years as so many individuals and families in the area struggle to keep up with the soaring cost of living. 

Full story for #ilovetheburg by Bob Carskadon at the link in our bio.

Do we need to do philanthropy differently? As someone who works with donors, I think we can. Are you ignorant or indifferent? One is not knowing and the other is not caring. How does this fit into philanthropy? If you don't know or understand you can't do better. Just like the addict, until we can walk with them and wait for them to understand they will do better. When the donor understands they also will do things differently. 

It is my job to learn, collaborate with others and  listen. Bringing everyone to the table so that we all understand and work together. Being part of the 36-hour Sanctum Care Group challenge has given me the confidence to look someone in the eyes and ask if they're okay and need help. I will also look my donors in the eyes and tell them about these unique programs in our community. We are offering them an opportunity to work with others and make a difference. 

When we don't know, we have fear, just like I did on my first challenge day. I will visit those frontlines on the streets often and hold some babies at Sanctum 1.5 because that is God's work in my eyes.

I’m out this morning doing my normal Sunday run. Checking in on a couple folks we occasionally drop food off too. Well this morning I encountered James. We’ve never met before this morning. 

James is disabled with very limited mobility. He’s currently unhoused and spent 6 years in the Navy. We spoke on benefits etc. James, camps out in the woods  and various areas. He stated his wife was previously with him. Unhoused as well. 

However, her health began to decline and the individual who took his wife in. Wouldn’t allow him to come. I haven’t verified any of his information as we’ll get on that tomorrow. As, of now. Our goal is to place him in a hotel for a week or two. We’d love to give him an opportunity to shower and get proper rest until we can get resources to help him. 

He’d prefer to stay in a hotel near the location where his wife is. The least expensive I’ve found as of now is $83 a night. 

Any contribution will assist us temporary shelter, clothing and food. He’s in need of a pair of slippers as well. Something easy to take on and off.

Dear friends, family, and compassionate individuals,

We hope this message finds you well. We are reaching out to share a recent and unexpected turn of events during our time on tour of Europe in December.

Troy Castro, Living Colour Tour Manager, a beloved father and friend, faced a critical health emergency that required immediate attention and an urgent surgery.

Unfortunately, the financial burden associated with an emergency surgery in a foreign country is overwhelming. Troy and his son Kai are facing significant medical expenses, travel costs, accommodation, and other associated costs that were unforeseen.

Troy is a dedicated, loving father and hard working, driven friend.
This is where we, as a community, can make a meaningful difference. 

We have started a GoFundMe campaign to raise funds for Troy's emergency surgery and related expenses. Every donation, no matter the size, will make a meaningful impact on Troy's journey to recovery.

Thank you for taking the time to read Troy's story and considering offering your support during this challenging time. Your kindness and generosity mean the world to us, and we are immensely grateful for any assistance you can provide.
Wishing you all health, happiness, and gratitude.

With heartfelt gratitude

@Bull_Run_Restaurant in Shirley, MA is a 2 Star Certified Green Restaurant®. This restaurant has taken 41 sustainability steps to earn more than 142.71 GreenPoints™. With back of house and front of house composting as well as a comprehensive recycling program, The Bull Run Restaurant is reducing the amount of its waste ending up in a landfill by up to 90%. This restaurant further reduces waste with grease recycling, reusable napkins, and a chalkboard menu for specials. The Bull Run Restaurant also reduces its energy usage with 2 Energy Star dishwasher, 3 Energy Star refrigerators, and 2 walk-in coolers with strip curtains, each of which saves enough energy to power a residential home for one year. To further reduce its environmental impact, this restaurant serves over 30% vegan and vegetarian main meals.

We have started work on our eighth garden, which will come to life at the Princess Royal Spinal Injuries Centre at Northern General Hospital in Sheffield @sheffieldhospitals! 👷

Charity founders Dr Olivia Chapple and David Chapple visited the site to celebrate 🎉

The garden has come so far since this time last year, when it started its life as the Best in Show winning garden at @the_rhs Chelsea Flower Show 2023, having been supported by @project.giving.back 🥇

Like our RHS Chelsea 2023 garden, the stunning and accessible Horatio’s Garden Sheffield & East has been designed by @harrisbuggstudio and is inspired by the history, geography and industry of its Yorkshire home. The garden will feature welcoming garden rooms designed by architects @mcmullanstudio, be built by Sheffield-based contractors RLX Construction and project managed by @gleedsglobal, and is supported by the @nationalgardenscheme 🌱

We are so excited to have broken ground on our eighth garden, and we can't wait to see Horatio’s Garden Sheffield & East open in 2025. To learn more, head to the link in our bio! 💚

Osny Kidd, once a DACA recipient, now a legal permanent resident of the United States, is no stranger to fighting for his rights and the rights of others. Today, we are asking for your help, as Osny is currently fighting for his life. 

In 2020, Osny, along with the Inland Coalition for Immigrant Justice (@ic4ij) and the Coalition for Humane Immigrant Rights (@chirla_org) filed a federal lawsuit against ICE, challenging the agency’s use of deception in order to enter immigrants’ homes. Despite the risk of retaliation, Osny stood on principle, and he stood up not only for himself but the thousands of immigrants just like him who are vulnerable to deceptive ICE tactics and abuse. 

Recently, Osny was diagnosed with a rare autoimmune disease, one that landed him in the hospital’s intensive care unit,  where he has remained for the past four weeks. This disease has left Osny debilitated, with loss of mobility in his arms and legs, and no ability to financially provide for his family. Even when released from the hospital, Osny will require extensive rehabilitative care, and he will not be able to return to work for the remainder of the year. 

Please consider standing in solidarity with Osny, and supporting this fundraising campaign. We cannot rely on the government to care for our community’s health and well-being; we must be a community that protects itself, and especially for people like Osny, who has fought to protect the community, taking on one of the largest law enforcement agencies in the world-- because it was the right thing to do, because it had to be done. 

Every contribution counts; please give what you can, and keep Osny and his family in your good thoughts. Link to donate is in our bio or go to: https://gofund.me/09540dc9. Thank you!🙏🏽.

Miley was reported by a concerned citizen missing part of her leg and not able to walk properly 😔

We sent the team immediately but unfortunately; she was nowhere to be found. Of course, we were not going to give up and asked the local guards to call us as soon as she reappeared in the area. Second time lucky and Miley was trapped and brought to the shelter. As we knew one of her legs was completely devoid of a paw but upon inspection, she was found to be suffering from mammary gland tumours which needed medical attention. After a few days, once Miley was more settled, she underwent surgery to remove the tumours. Samples were sent off to check if the tumours were benign or malignant. Once the results are received then the vets can proceed with the appropriate treatment but for now, Miley is comfortable and getting tons of love and care.💜🐾

‌

We can only continue to help these poor animals because of you. We receive no government funding, so please help us to save as many lives such as Miley as possible.

CWC Year 4 Fellow Khloe @khloe_taylor_thompson is attending CCA’s pre-college program @cacollegeofarts this summer in San Francisco!

Since she was just 8 years old, Khloe has been captivated by the world of fashion design. Fueled by her grandmother’s exceptional sewing skills, Khloe’s passion for creating clothes blossomed. 

“As an artist, I’m inspired by anything. Anything I see can make me want to create an illustration. I love creating dresses, even sketching a dress you can make shapes and change the overall look of how it will appear on the body. I think the illusion of garments is what I totally love.”

Khloe founded a nonprofit organization (Khloe Kares) supporting women experiencing homelessness. She is passionate about philanthropy having raised funds to build water pumps in Ghanaian schools without access to clean water.

Inspired by artists who merge different eras, such as Michael Wilkinson, the costume designer for “Jingle Jangle,” Khloe is fascinated by the fusion of Afro-Victorian styles with contemporary patterns and colors. She draws inspiration from African fashion, embracing its vibrant patterns and cultural significance.
 
Please read our blog post highlighting Khloe and the other fellows attending CCA pre-college this summer.

📢 **Help Rebuild and Resecure Ladywell Village Fruit n Veg!** 🍎🍐🥦

We are a group of neighbours from Ladywell and Catford, friends and customers of Ladywell Village Fruit n Veg.

Ladywell Village Fruit and Veg is an independent greengrocer giving the local community a great variety of fresh fruit and veg without limitation. Since opening in 2021, the shop has become a cornerstone of our neighbourhood, not just for its breadth of choice and quality of produce, but for something far more special— the owner, Patsy.

Patsy owns and operates the shop entirely on her own after losing her job as a housing officer in 2013. She’s always in the shop, welcoming customers with a warm smile and a friendly conversation. For many of us, Patsy is more than just the local grocer— she’s a recipe sharer, a source of culinary advice, an importer not just of vegetables, but of knowledge and care.

On May 29th, Patsy’s shop was violently broken into, the front window smashed and the till stolen. This is the second time the shop has been broken into this year, and the costs of continuously having to repair the shop and the loss of income when the shop is closed have become crippling for an independent shop like Patsy’s.

So we’ve decided to set up a fundraiser on her behalf! We need to raise £3000 in total, breakdown below:

💰 Till replacement: £500 
🪟 Window repair: £350 
📉 Loss of income: £120 
💸 Petty cash stolen: £30 
🔒 Electronic window shutter: £1300 
📹 CCTV replacement: £700 

With your support, we can help Patsy replace what was stolen, secure her shop with new shutters and CCTV, and ensure she can continue serving our community safely and securely.

🙏 Please donate generously and help us secure the future of this wonderful corner of Ladywell. Every little bit helps!

🔗 www.gofundme.com/f/ladywell-village-fruit-and-veg-recovery-fund

Thank you for your support!

❤️ Patsy’s Friends and Neighbours

Nelle ultime settimane, in Tanzania, si sono verificate forti piogge che hanno causato catastrofiche inondazioni e frane, lasciando le persone senza cibo, acqua, medicinali o beni di prima necessità.
In alcune zone ha piovuto troppo e l’acqua ha spazzato via interi villaggi. Qui le persone hanno perso tutto quello che avevano, non solo le loro case sono state distrutte ma le alluvioni hanno anche causato vittime.
Molti terreni sono stati allagati e i campi di conseguenza non si possono coltivare, manca così cibo e le molte strade impraticabili impediscono di portare gli aiuti possibili.
 
In questo momento difficile queste persone hanno urgentemente bisogno del nostro sostegno.
Stiamo raccogliendo i fondi per aiutare in modo concreto i più bisognosi e i più colpiti da questo disastro naturale. (LINK IN BIO GOFUNDME)
 
Unisciti a noi… aiutiamoli a ricostruire le loro vite!
Un piccolo gesto può fare la differenza e aiutare molte persone.

Per maggiori informazioni scrivici sui social o a questo indirizzo:
upendo.odv@gmail.com

Afgelopen weekend was er weer een bijeenkomst van ex-JG.nl. De 18 deelnemers en 3 coaches gingen aan de slag met het thema "Identiteit".

Wat betekent opgroeien in de organisatie van Jehovah's Getuigen voor de ontwikkeling van je identiteit? Wat is de invloed van deze groepsidentiteit op de rest van jouw leven? Hoe ontdek je wat jij wil? Wat is jouw identiteit zonder de organisatie?

Het was bijzonder om met elkaar na te denken over het antwoord op deze vragen. Wat een kracht zat er ook weer in deze groep! Ik ben waanzinnig trots op alle deelnemers en op de coaches die met mij dit programma hebben geschreven.

Op zaterdag 21 september zijn we er weer. Wil je op de hoogte blijven van de bijeenkomsten en alle andere dingen die ex-JG.nl aan het doen is? Schrijf je dan in voor de nieuwsbrief. Dit doe je door mij even een berichtje te sturen met daarin je emailadres.

Wil je het werk van ex-JG.nl ondersteunen? Je kan een donatie doen via onze GoFundMe pagina. Link in bio.

Wil je meedenken over de inhoud en locatie voor de bijeenkomsten? Alle tips zijn welkom!

I have a dear friend who is also a therapist who needs help right now during their time of physical healing. They have had multiple surgeries and now needs a specialized treatment, Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy, everyday for 4 weeks. The treatment center is 2 hours away and costs $200/day. This #gofundme is set up to raise money for their treatment and for housing near the facility so they and their family do not have to drive back and forth everyday. They are choosing to stay anonymous. I personally know this therapist and they supported me through one of the most difficult moments of my life. Another amazing milestone has been reached by South West Blood Bikes in 2024, over 40,000 items have been collected, transported and delivered by our fantastic, dedicated  volunteers, who give so much of their time to help others in the communities they live and work in!

These items have all been transported on behalf of the NHS and other Medical Facilities in Devon since the charity began in 2018, all completely FREE of charge! The items range from whole blood, blood & other biological samples, patient notes, medication, medical equipment and even donor breast milk for premature babies.

We do not receive any funding from the NHS or its patients for this service, it is run entirely on the generous donations from the general public, community groups, local businesses, volunteer fundraising and some grant funding. Every penny donated goes towards keeping the charity operational. Everyone in the charity is a VOLUNTEER and we have NO paid staff.

Please help us continue to be able to provide this service for many years to come an by using the donate link below. Please remember to tick the Gift Aid box if you are eligible, every penny really does make a difference.

Thank you ❤

Dear Friends, Family, and Kind Strangers,

I am reaching out in a time of desperate need. My beloved dog, Sonechko, was recently involved in a terrible accident at the park. She stepped on something sharp, resulting in a clean cut that required immediate surgery. The total cost of the surgery is 700 euros, an amount that I simply cannot afford as an intern living on a scholarship.

Sonechko means the world to me. She’s been my loyal companion through thick and thin, always there to bring a smile to my face. Seeing her in pain breaks my heart, and I am doing everything I can to ensure she gets the care she needs.

I am asking for your help to cover the cost of her surgery and post-operative care. Any amount, no matter how small, would make a huge difference and help me bring Sonechko back home, healthy and happy.

Please consider donating and sharing this post with others who might be able to help. Your kindness and generosity would mean the world to both of us in this difficult time.

How to Donate:
Gofundme or

Revolut: LT19 3250 0816 7652 4637, Polina Sidelova

Every bit of support counts, and I will be forever grateful for any assistance you can provide.

Thank you from the bottom of my heart <3

Polina

Today is the last day of both EDS and Mental Health Awareness Months. For me, they go hand in hand. Let me preface this by saying I know many hold the beliefs that it always be worse, & that positivity is the only way. For me, the first is stating the obvious, & as for the second one, I disagree as there are a plethora of emotions we should be feeling.

This is something I’ve been hesitant to talk about as it’s such a complex subject for me, but this surgery seems to have given me back my ability to eat many foods I could not previously eat without throwing up. If you know me well you know in 2022 I lost 50lbs because I couldn’t eat. We were at the point of discussing a feeding tube. I put myself in thousands of $ of debt trying every GI test, but found nothing. I gave up, I ate nothing but bland or puréed food. There were times I wanted to die.

Fast forward when I met my thoracic (slipping rib) surgeon. He asked very specific GI questions. I answered, he told me the obvious. EDS patients have GI issues, often severe but sometimes not caused by the GI tract itself. I already knew about vascular compressions he told me about (I looked into them years prior but was too broke to pursue it). He told me *SOMETIMES* when the ribs are crushing certain intercostal nerves, it can cause them to send the wrong signals to the GI tract. I heard him but went into surgery not considering my GI issues may be fixed. 

I’m slowly reintroducing foods I haven’t eaten in years. I haven’t felt the need to throw up once. I am thrilled, heartbroken and absolutely furious. 

I live in a body that plays tricks on me. I am surrounded by doctors who don’t know how my body works & stuck in a healthcare system that does not care if I live or die. 

All this for just one of my issues.

My final words on EDS & Mental Health are that both are extremely complex. Both the general public and the healthcare industry need to take the time to better understand them.

This week’s #CoffeesforGaza family are Rewaa, Mohammed and their three children Ali (6), Tia (5) and Maria (8 months). 🍉☕️💕

Before the aggressions began, the family had a beautiful life, a comfortable warm home, successful careers, and the older children were attending preschool. Rewaa was an apiarist, working with a big team of engineers to produce honey 🐝 and Mohammed was a medical doctor at Al-Shifa hospital.

Little Maria was born only a week before October 7, and the family had to flee their home, which was later bombed, when Rewaa was in her early post-partum with their newborn baby. Can you imagine this? Since then, the family has been displaced numerous times, including very recently when the occupation forces began their ground invasion of Rafah.

If you’d like a copy of this hand-printed card, donate €15 or more to their campaign, DM @marinazart with a screenshot of your donation receipt & postal address.

We are so happy to welcome back @freemomhugsoklahoma on June 29th. 

Free Mom Hugs works to empower the world to celebrate the LGBTQIA+ community. We embrace people of all faiths, backgrounds, ethnicities, genders, and sexual orientations. Their goal is to change the world simply by showing up. 

Founded by a fierce advocate and mother, Free Mom Hugs provides visibility, conversation, and education with the hope of reconciling relationships. They sincerely believe that broken family relationships can be restored, and we work to equip family members, friends, and allies with valuable resources so they can love well.

Their goal is not to replace family relationships, but to display their celebration and love for the LGBTQIA+ community so that family members feel encouraged to do the same. Though they’re known as Free Mom Hugs, they welcome dads, aunts, uncles, brothers, sisters, grandparents, and friends to be part of this movement of inclusion fueled by love. 

Their desire is that this work restores relationships, and that families are reconciled through the hope and power of Sara and Parker’s story.

The programs and initiatives we use to accomplish their mission vary, but most often include:
❤️Public speaking engagements for corporations, churches, sporting events, schools, and universities.
🩷Peaceful demonstrations to show support and advocate for LGBTQIA+ rights.
💙Collaborating with local and national organizations like the Human Rights Campaign, PFLAG, The Trevor Project, and more.
🧡Participating in Pride events and parades.
💛Providing resources for individuals and families.
💚Creating programs to educate and uplift communities.

ChatGPT creator OpenAI's CEO, Sam Altman, who recently achieved billionaire status, has signed the Giving Pledge with his partner, Oliver Mulherin. 

The Giving Pledge was established in 2010 by Bill Gates, Melinda French Gates, and Warren Buffett. 

It is worth noting that Altman does not hold equity in OpenAI. His wealth comes from his diverse investment portfolio, which includes stakes in companies like Reddit and Stripe. 

Other high-profile Giving Pledge signatories include MacKenzie Scott, Reid Hoffman, Marc Benioff, Elon Musk, Larry Ellison, Mark Zuckerberg, and Priscilla Chan.

💛 This is a difficult post to write but I need to call in some support. (AND PLEASE SHARE)
-
Some of you know my incredible sister (in-law) Jen Zappia. Well, despite a preventative double mastectomy, her pathology report just confirmed invasive cancer. 
-
As you can imagine, our family is devastated by this and we know there’s a long road ahead. 
-
I’m asking that you join us in coming alongside of her, her husband (Justin) and their 3 kids (Izzy, Zander, and Tyler) during this time as we aim to ease the financial burden that this is going to take on her as she fights this cancer! 
-
Our goal is to raise $50,000 to assist with medical expenses, and easy the family burden of her having to stop working as a nurse in order to receive all the treatment that is necessary.
-
We’ve launched a GoFundMe page with the hope that you will help us in embodying Romans 12:9-13 during this challenging journey.

For the past 8 months, the Shelter has seen a sharp decrease in local fosters and adoptions. The Shelter is too overcrowded and Diana's own yard is becoming that way too, with: 
- 12 cats (only 6 of which are actually Diana's pets)
- 3 kittens
- 7 cats in her garage 
- 7 dogs; one blind, one with nerve problems. 

Diana is busier than she has ever been; waking up at 5:30  every day and no days off, taking care of and cleaning up after her mini-zoo, going to work, coming home to take care of her elderly mother and the house and trying to secure donations to cover all the expenses of the shelter.

Que ça fait du bien de parler d'autre chose que mon cancer ! Enfin oui mon deuxième petit fils est né ''Noé'' ce beau ptit bébé , et que dire de son grand frère d'a peine un an et demi ''Caleb'' qui fait cela comme un champion !

Vous savez depuis que Caleb est au monde soit le 31 janvier 2023 , ma fille ne manque pas une journée sans m'appeler en Facetime afin que je puisse créé une relation malgré la distance qui nous sépare. 

Et bien je dois vous avouer , nous chialons après la technologie mais honnêtement sans Facetime que se serait difficile car je ne pourrais le voir environ que 2 ou 3 par année.

Avec mon cancer, je suis limitée dans ce que je peux faire dû à ma grande fatigue, mais une chose que je sais faire est de les bercer, les dorloter et cela n'a aucun prix.

J'espère juste que j'aurai suffisamment de temps pour que Noé puisse me connaître comme mon Caleb d'amour.

Je vous présente en photo mes deux incroyables petits fils.

Bon dimanche à tous! et merci infiniment de ''partager''

Today and recently has been very hard on us, especially for money, and life situations 
One situation in particular is my sister’s chameleon Pickle, becoming suddenly Egg-Bound (I think that’s the term for our situation) 

Pickle’s leg has become swollen aswell, we assume from her current situation. 
She has a lay bin and proper husbandry. We have been providing her calcium dusted crickets at appropriate times (feeding times) and even have tried to give her extra water because she needs to stay hydrated and seems to be too weak right now to get to her water dish.

We NEED help. 
Specifically help TO SAVE HER LIFE.

Pickle is in desperate need of help from a vet. Which we would have been able to afford before the bills came up and my water heater broke in the house AND my moms tire completely flattened on her car (had to buy new tire) aswell as my mom’s car radiator breaking or whatever too so ermmmm

Thank you so much for taking your time to read this. Shares or even donations would mean the world to me as I cannot imagine life without my sister’s Chameleon.

Capturing things the human eye should not see is always tough. Below this trash they're actually three humans this is their house. There's no bombs being dropped here, there's no natural disasters happening. This is just humanity potentially at its lowest. As a photographer sometimes this stuff hits us hard. This was the first day I was there and I still couldn't post it till days later. If there is a God I hope he has mercy on their souls. No one should have to live like this in America or the world. The youngest person was 19 years old the oldest person was 67. They have each other's backs cuz that's all they have. The horror that is seen here is something I could never imagine.

We desperately need help with donations 🙏😔

We hope what we do is good. It’s hard to know with the endless pain we see.❤️‍🩹

Yesterday, we went with Prince to the vet after what is now 3 horrible weeks of vets, examinations, CT scan, antibiotics, sleepless nights, being in pain, not being able to walk, and just one hour later, we had another emergency with Abi where she is drowsy and falling down😱 Not a day goes by that we don’t have at least 5 unexpected problems.❗

At this moment, we have Puki in Kennels, which is £450 due today🚨 Sharka and Cairo unexpectedly need to leave their homes, and we can’t even predict the costs, A FOOD BILL paid in half that we wont be able able to make a new order, a VET debt that just keeps getting bigger, Abi, Sammi, Buster and Lucky waiting for their boosters and POOR BABY BADA will need another check up to a specialist before they decide on surgery😔 

The dog food for our 36 animals is £800, the vet is £1600, Puki £450, Bada’s transportation to the vet in Bitola is £90, the pharmacy cost us at least £80 a month, gasoline for the generator is £120 and since all of this work is IMPOSSIBLE with just 2 people and no volunteers, we have to pay workers £690 a month😔🙏

We hope what we do is good. But with just a few people doing everything: the rescuing, the cleaning, social media, driving, vet visits, socializing, everything that you see, and everything that we have no time to post…there is constant stress and confusion. It’s hard to look at the big picture when you are stuck in a million problems every day, a million information about the pills, the wounds, the food, the vaccines, the long waiting for adoption, the problems with the adopted dogs in UK, fears about their safety, fears about their future😔🚨

Introducing our new donate tab! We have added a few new donation features to our website :) 
https://champschance.org

If you click on the red donation tab at the top of our website, you will see two drop down options. The one they says “Donate” will take you to a page where you can either choose to make a one time donation, or a reoccurring monthly one. These options allow you to now be able to donate directly from your card/bank account. We know that some aren’t comfortable using apps like venmo and cashapp, so we wanted to provide a more accessible option. 

If you hit the “Dedicated Donations tab” , you are able to dedicate a donation to a specific animal, person, situation, etc. Each name listed represents a heartfelt tribute and a generous act that helps us provide care and a loving home for dogs in need. We wanted to add a sentimental / interactive aspect to donations, to better connect with the community and allow everyone to spotlight an animal/person/ situation that impacted them.

We want to thank everyone that supports us every day in our mission of saving lives. We would not be able to do what we do without the help of our community. We are drowning in medical bills and tornado repairs. Please continue to help us help them 🤍🐾

Hey beautiful humans,

I come to you with thrilling news! I’m on the brink of a life-changing journey: gender affirming top surgery. It marks a pivotal moment in my transition, one that I’ve openly shared since 2018 to offer insight and support, particularly in South Africa where resources and representation are scarce. However, this step comes with a hefty price tag, which is why I’ve launched a BackABuddy fundraiser. Your support, whether through donations or sharing, will bring me closer to realizing this dream. 

LINK IN BIO 

Top surgery isn’t just about physical changes; it’s about reclaiming my comfort and confidence in my own skin. It’s about feeling whole and authentic in every aspect of my being. If you’re curious to learn more about my journey, I’ve poured my heart out in a detailed story on the fundraising page.

LINK IN BIO 

Your contribution, big or small, is invaluable and deeply appreciated. If donating isn’t feasible for you, simply spreading the word within your networks can make a world of difference.

LINK IN BIO 

And to my fellow queer community, my DMs are always open. Whether you need advice, a listening ear, or just a friendly chat, I’m here for you. Let’s continue uplifting and supporting each other on this beautiful journey of self-discovery and empowerment. Much love and gratitude to you all! 💖✨

LINK IN BIO
