✨The Giveaway✨

THE ESSENCE
The Giveaway is the gift you offer to life, without attachment, without expecting anything back. You can only give what is truly yours: a smile, a nod of encouragement, a gentle touch, and a kind word. This is not giving to others what you no longer want, like the sweater that no longer fits, but gifting that which is most precious-your authentic love and genuine feelings.

THE INVITATION
Make a list of 10 people and things for which you are grateful. Connect with the feeling of gratitude. The giveaway comes to ask you to feel the same gratitude without needing anything or anyone to inspire it, and to share this gratitude with those you meet.

As you offer thanks, your heart opens and you start realizing how much life has given you. You heal your feelings of scarcity and open yourself to the abundance that surrounds you. The giveaway invites you to be in the flow of life, as you give freely and receive freely.

THE MEDICINE
Is it difficult for you to set limits on how much of yourself you give? If you give more than is healthy, then you will not be able to give for long.

You’ll feel resentful with your partner or associates, or you’ll feel like the world owes you something in return.
Notice if you give for any reason other than pure generosity. Are you trying to be liked or accepted? Are you hoping to heal an old wound?

Start giving to yourself first and foremost. Offer yourself the care, the love, the time, and the acceptance that you are longing for. Once you experience plenty, then you can truly give to others.

I was dating & living with Sam aka HowieRoll, aka Scott Byers, aka Rob Thick, after getting out of a bad situation in North Carolina. Things were good for the first couple of weeks or so. Then things slowly went downhill. 

Thursday, I had to get my Honda towed to the house where Sam & I were living because I got a flat tire on the way to do food delivery. My Honda at the time was loaded down with all my belongings in it. I'm not even sure if I can get to it or if the platform bed shifted to where I can't get to it. 

I moved out late Thursday 5/23/24 into early Friday 5/24/25 morning after he accused me of having a man in his room. Unfortunately I had to leave my Honda at the house.

I was gone for 1.5 days, and in that time, someone smashed in my radiator and everything in that area. I found out about this when I tried to pick up my Honda on Saturday 5/25/24 when I thought it was just the tire. Coincidence, I think 🤔 not. 

There are videos posted to YouTube from Thursday with the flat tire to the break up to teying to pick up my Honda on Saturday to Tuesday when i finally was able to move my Honda to a safe location.

Flat Tire Video 👇
https://youtube.com/shorts/Gi09On34q6c?si=rC4qPWfMuc8PRrTU

Break up video 👇
https://youtu.be/a6p5K-23GPw?si=k78DUp2iD9O5GD3D

Saturday 5/25/24 👇
https://youtu.be/9oqEWlPRA64?si=_cc0gjtnUreET-2r

Tuesday 5/28/24 👇
https://youtu.be/mXlzB0Dmb1w?si=UDVuPdB3mf4xm7wK

Police & State troopers won't do anything because I have no proof. I only have liability insurance. I've not been able to find employment outside of food delivery because I've moved around a lot. 

I got my Honda off the property I lived at with Sam on Tuesday 5/28/24 with the donations from a friend. The Honda has no new damage from Saturday to Tuesday. I had it towed to the property my friend is letting me stay at. 

With donations I'll be able to pay my cellphone bill, see if I can find a mobile mechanic to come out and look at my Honda. Buy 3 used tires & make repairs on my Honda. 

I'm currently staying with a friend, but have no means of transportation other than using rideshare as there are no transit system out here.

Yesterday we were thrilled to be able to help Robbie out with new brake pads at short notice and to learn about his epic adventure.
Robbie is raising awareness that chemotherapy is not to be feared and that you can still live well and extend your life ♥️
He is aiming to cycle 1000 miles around the UK and enter the Guinness Book of Records for the longest cycle journey conducted by a chemotherapy patient.
Robbie is receiving treatment for a brain tumour and is raising funds for Brain Tumour Research UK and Brainstorm UK via GoFundMe (link in the comments). 
What makes this even more outstanding is that Rob confessed that he is not a cyclist (although is a keen runner), furthermore he is tackling this challenge solo and completely unaided. No back-up or support other than video calls to his love ones - incredible! 🤯

If the demands of your practice and personal life don't allow the time for 20 hours of pro bono work, you can still fulfill your goal with a donation to Southern Legal Counsel!

In response to a need for legal services to the poor, the Florida Supreme Court ruled in 1992 that lawyers should aspire to do 20 hours of pro bono work each year OR contribute $350 to a legal aid organization.

We are at the forefront of the fight for LGBTQ rights in Florida, while also protecting the civil, constitutional and education rights of Floridians with severe legal needs. From transgender Floridians in need of health care, to our unhoused neighbors whose rights are being violated in local government sweeps, to children with disabilities in need of access to special education, thousands of Floridians count on us in their pursuit of justice. And they are counting on you to make sure we can continue to serve them. 

Donate now so that we can continue our important work: https://bit.ly/3NIk21g

Anthony at college graduate of UCLA, one night decided to smoke meth. And forever changed his outlook and his life. This is before I met him. After exchanging some words we started talking suffering from schizophrenia and abandonment and other issues. I had my luggage I gave him my pants and I gave him a T-shirt so we could feel more humanized. The question he asked is why did you help? I was like we're all humans we all need help. For some reason my photography draws me to people that need help. Who do you work for what agency. No one this is just the kindness of my heart. I let him use my phone he called his mom he hasn't talked to in 7 years, I was late for something but his mother come and pick him up and I truly wish everything but the best for this gentleman. Instead of judging these people we can learn a lot and give the kindness of our heart

I would love if you could take the time to read my little story on the fundraiser and hopefully learn a more about how I’m feeling about my journey.

Okay, untuk pencarum di bawah Great Eastern Takaful Berhad, saya share kan bagaimana anda nak dapatkan Family Takaful Statement 2022,untuk di gunakan sewaktu isi E-filling ni ya. Tekan link di bawah untuk login :

https://igetintouch.greateasterntakaful.com/econnect-new/#/login

➡️Pergi ke My Document
➡️Search Family Takaful Statement 2022
➡️Anda download dan isikan dalam E-filling.

Siap!

Mudah sahaja. Untung orang yang asingkan duit untuk wujudkan plan takaful. Duit tu akan bagi manfaat pada dia dan keluarga. Kalau tak tuntut pengurangan cukai ni, anda akan bayar lebih kepada jabatan cukai.

Baik bayar dekat diri sendiri dengan adakan plan takaful kan?

Jadi bagi yang belum ada apa-apa polisi takaful, ambil la segera, pada tahun 2023. Nanti next year, pada tahun 2024,anda pun boleh tuntut pengurangan ni.

Ouh, 1 lagi, nanti dekat family takaful statement 2022 tu, akan ada term :

➡️Family takaful = Ini untuk portion "life insurance" tu ya.
➡️Medical = Ini untuk portion "medical and education Insurance"
➡️Others = Ada yang anda boleh ambil untuk masukkan ke medical portion atau life portion, dan ada juga yang tak boleh claim. Nanti dalam form tu ada tulis.

Maximum untuk life insurance + Epf ialah Rm3, 000 
Maximum untuk medical + education insurance ialah Rm3, 000 juga.

Total Rm6, 000.

Kalau anda bayar bulanan Rm200, setahun bayaran ialah Rm2, 400. Akan ada yang boleh tuntut di bawah limit medical, dan juga di bawah limit life.

Kongsi kan pada rakan-rakan, supaya tiada yang terlepas pandang, dan tak tuntut pengurangan cukai ni.

Semua syarikat takaful pun pasti ada statement ni ya, bukan GETB sahaja.

*Yang nak copy and paste, silakan ya. Tak perlu letak di komen. Cuma buang je baris ayat ini. Moga bermanfaat buat semua.

If you owe taxes because of your spouse, you may be eligible for Innocent Spouse Relief. ⠀
⠀
In order to help taxpayers that are being subjected to tax problems because of their spouse’s actions, the IRS has guidelines where a person might qualify as an innocent spouse. This means that if we can prove our client fits in these guidelines, they may not be subject to the tax problems caused by their current or former spouse. ⠀
⠀
In many cases, Omni can help protect one spouse from the actions of the other. Contact our team of experts today to see if you qualify at omni-financial.com.

买了保险，税务已经扣到Max了吗？

你知道吗？很多年轻人在报税时都RUGI了！！！
😱😱😱
做么会这样叻？🤔

原来人寿保险可以扣RM3000的税，然而很多年轻人都买4合一的保单，有综合人寿和医药保障在里面。

假设保费每年RM3000，其实里面大概有2/3是属于医药保费，一般大概只有RM1000左右是人寿保险。

👉👉既然只有RM1000左右是人寿保费， 那么就还有RM2000左右的扣税空间了！！
👉👉善用这RM2000的扣税空间，买份储蓄保险给自己， 即可储蓄，又可以扣税，是不是很香呢？

例子：如果你的应课税收入(Chargeable Income ) 介于50K-70K，这个人需要被Tax 14%。 
如果放RM2000过来储蓄,不用被Tax，这RM2000是不是等于现赚14%？
现赚14% 啊！！香不香啊？

温馨提醒： 
✅✅今年付的保费， 明年就可以拿来扣税了！！！
❎❎如果明年才买的话，要后年才可以扣税 . . .
又RUGI 一年了。

这星期真的要帮忙，想要利用保险来节税的人。

问问看下你身边的朋友，人寿保险扣足RM3000的税了吗？如果他们不清楚的话，小手动一动在下方留言⬇️

🔥Hazard insurance premiums paid in advance or into the lender’s escrow account
🔥Homeowner’s association dues and condominium dues
Rent for pre-occupancy of home
🔥Charges for utilities

Omni Financial has been in the tax relief industry for over 35 years, so we've seen it all when it comes to tax debt. Here are the top 3 biggest mistakes people make when it comes to their tax debt…and what they should do instead. ⠀
⠀
Instead of: ⠀
❌ Ignoring the tax balance due ⠀
❌ Not opening tax notices ⠀
❌  Randomly making payments here and there ⠀
⠀
Do this instead: ⠀
✅ Call a tax professional for free consultation ⠀
✅ Open tax notices and see if you have appeal rights ⠀
✅ Set up a payment plan because random payments don't prevent a levy action ⠀
⠀

The tax season is officially here! Have you filed your taxes yet? There are still a few days left if you are still looking to reduce your taxable income - here are some types of tax reliefs you can apply for to reduce your personal income tax!

Do you know that fertility treatments such as Intra-Uterine Insemination (IUI) and In-Vitro Fertilisation (IVF) undergone by married couples (taxpayers) in the year 2022 can enjoy up to RM8,000 of income tax relief? This was an initiative by the Malaysian government that acknowledges the fact that almost all medical insurance do not cover fertility treatments and income tax relief for medical expenses is one of the ways to lighten the burden and manage your fertility journey. Want to know how? Find out more information from your fertility clinic and Lembaga Hasil Dalam Negeri Malaysia and take advantage of possible tax savings on your fertility expenses.

🇺🇸This Veterans Day week, as we reflect on the selflessness of those who've worn our nation's uniform, we are proud to share a heartfelt project from @swoffordcareercenter.  Under the guidance of Instructor Jared Duncan, welding students have utilized their skills to build beautiful benches for The Wall That Heals, currently at the Spartanburg Airport until Sunday at 2 pm.

We encourage you to visit The Wall That Heals and invite you to take a moment of rest on these benches to remember and appreciate the sacrifices made by our brave men and women in uniform, and their families.  Let the reflection spot offer you a place to connect with history and with our community's gratitude.  It's a rare opportunity to be a part of something so meaningful - a wall that heals, and indeed, a wall that teaches. ❤️

We want to give a big thank you to the Veterinary Students of Puerto Rico (@vetstudentspr) from Ross University School of Veterinary Medicine for a surprise generous donation we received. In the first few months of 2020, they came together to raise funds for Puerto Rico’s earthquakes and Australia’s bushfires. We are honored that they chose us to be a recipient of their efforts: "The students and faculty from Puerto Rico at RUSVM mobilized our community soon after the disaster events, in an effort to raise funds to assist with relief efforts for animals in the affected areas.  The students decided to donate the monies to your organization, as it proves to be one that year after year continues to provide a holistic approach to improving animal welfare in Puerto Rico." Thank you so much to each and everyone of these students for their advocacy on behalf of the animals in Puerto Rico (and around the world) and for helping us save more lives.

A Visit to a Nursing Home

Our students and school administration at Ishik Duhok International Boys' Secondary School recently visited a local nursing home to spread some joy and show their appreciation for the residents and staff. They were welcomed by the manager, Mr. Saadi, who gave them a warm tour of the facility.

Our students brought gifts for the residents, who were thrilled to receive the gifts, and there were many smiles and hugs to go around.

We are grateful for the opportunity to have visited the nursing home, and we hope to return soon.

سەردانێک بۆ خانەی بەساڵاچووان

قوتابییەکانمان و کارگێڕی قوتابخانەی ئیشقی دهۆکی ماسیکی بنەڕەتی نێودەوڵەتیمان لەم دواییانەدا سەردانی خانەی بەساڵاچووانیان کرد بۆ بڵاوکردنەوەی هەندێک خۆشی و نیشاندانی پێزانینی خۆیان بۆ بەتەمەنەکان و ستافەکە. لەلایەن بەڕێوەبەر کاک سەعدی پێشوازییان لێکرا و پێکە بەناو خانەکەدا گەڕان.

قوتابییەکانمان هەندێک دیارییان پێشکەشکردن، و ئەوانیش دڵخۆش بوون بە دیارییەکان، و کاتێکی خۆشیان بەسەربرد.

سوپاسگوزارین بۆ ئەو دەرفەتەی کە سەردانی خانەی بەساڵاچووانمان کردووە، هیوادارین بەم زووانە بگەڕێینەوە.

زيارة إلى دار رعاية المسنين

قام طلابنا وإدارة المدرسة في مدرسة عشق دهوك الثانوية الدولية للبنين مؤخرًا بزيارة دار رعاية محلية لنشر بعض الفرح وإظهار تقديرهم للمقيمين والموظفين. تم استقبالهم بحفاوة من قبل المدير، السيد سعدي، الذي قدم لهم جولة دافئة في المنشأة.

قدم طلابنا هدايا للمقيمين، الذين كانوا سعداء بتلقي الهدايا، وكان هناك الكثير من الابتسامات والأحضان.

نحن ممتنون لإتاحة الفرصة لنا لزيارة دار رعاية المسنين، ونأمل أن نعود قريبًا.

🌟 Spreading Love and Empathy 🌟

I couldn't be prouder of the amazing students at the @schools! This was a while back when they had the incredible opportunity to visit the local old age home and make a positive impact in the lives of our elderly community members. Witnessing their empathy and compassion firsthand fills my heart with joy! ❤️

These young hearts spent the day spreading love and happiness by feeding the elderly residents, engaging in heartwarming conversations, and brightening up their day. It's truly inspiring to see how our students have embraced the value of empathy, understanding, and respect for all generations.

I believe that instilling such qualities in our future leaders is essential, and these children are shining examples of compassion in action. By encouraging them to be kind and caring individuals, we are fostering a generation that will make a significant difference in the world.

Let's continue to inspire and empower our children to become responsible and empathetic citizens. Together, we can make the world a brighter place for everyone! 🌎✨

𝗠𝘂𝘀𝗶𝗺 𝗖𝘂𝗸𝗮𝗶 𝘁𝗶𝗯𝗮 𝗹𝗮𝗴𝗶! 𝗥𝘂𝗴𝗶 𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗮𝗸 𝗮𝗺𝗯𝗶𝗹 𝗽𝗼𝗹𝗶𝘀𝗶 𝘁𝗮𝗸𝗮𝗳𝘂𝗹, 𝗮𝗱𝗮 𝗥𝗺𝟲, 𝟬𝟬𝟬 𝗽𝗲𝗻𝗴𝘂𝗿𝗮𝗻𝗴𝗮𝗻 𝗰𝘂𝗸𝗮𝗶 𝘁𝗮𝘄.

Okay, untuk pencarum di bawah Great Eastern Takaful Berhad, saya share kan bagaimana anda nak dapatkan Family Takaful Statement 2022,untuk di gunakan sewaktu isi E-filling ni ya. Tekan link di bawah untuk login :

https://igetintouch.greateasterntakaful.com/econnect-new/#/login

➡️Pergi ke My Document
➡️Search Family Takaful Statement 2022
➡️Anda download dan isikan dalam E-filling.

Siap!

Mudah sahaja. Untung orang yang asingkan duit untuk wujudkan plan takaful. Duit tu akan bagi manfaat pada dia dan keluarga. Kalau tak tuntut pengurangan cukai ni, anda akan bayar lebih kepada jabatan cukai.

Baik bayar dekat diri sendiri dengan adakan plan takaful kan?

Jadi bagi yang belum ada apa-apa polisi takaful, ambil la segera, pada tahun 2023. Nanti next year, pada tahun 2024,anda pun boleh tuntut pengurangan ni.

Ouh, 1 lagi, nanti dekat family takaful statement 2022 tu, akan ada term :

➡️Family takaful = Ini untuk portion "life insurance" tu ya.
➡️Medical = Ini untuk portion "medical and education Insurance"
➡️Others = Ada yang anda boleh ambil untuk masukkan ke medical portion atau life portion, dan ada juga yang tak boleh claim. Nanti dalam form tu ada tulis.

Maximum untuk life insurance + Epf ialah Rm3, 000 
Maximum untuk medical + education insurance ialah Rm3, 000 juga.

Total Rm6, 000.

Kalau anda bayar bulanan Rm200, setahun bayaran ialah Rm2, 400. Akan ada yang boleh tuntut di bawah limit medical, dan juga di bawah limit life.

Kongsi kan pada rakan-rakan, supaya tiada yang terlepas pandang, dan tak tuntut pengurangan cukai ni.

Semua syarikat takaful pun pasti ada statement ni ya, bukan GETB sahaja.

*Yang nak copy and paste, silakan ya. Tak perlu letak di komen. Cuma buang je baris ayat ini. Moga bermanfaat buat semua.

If you owe taxes because of your spouse, you may be eligible for Innocent Spouse Relief. ⠀
⠀
In order to help taxpayers that are being subjected to tax problems because of their spouse’s actions, the IRS has guidelines where a person might qualify as an innocent spouse. This means that if we can prove our client fits in these guidelines, they may not be subject to the tax problems caused by their current or former spouse. ⠀
⠀
In many cases, Omni can help protect one spouse from the actions of the other. Contact our team of experts today to see if you qualify at omni-financial.com.

The national Budget for 2022:
1. Tax relief for self funded Covid-19 booster shots and related costs.
2. Tax relief for health examination expenses expanded to cover mental health services.
3. Tax relief for purchase of phones, computers and tablets will be extended.
4. Tax relief on upskilling and self enhancement course Fees.
5. Expansion of Tax Relief on EPF Contributions
6. Expansion of Tax Relief on SOCSO Contributions
7. Higher tax relief for childcare centres and kindergartens fees
8. Tax exemption on prize money from e-sports tournaments
9. Tax relief for electric vehicles ownership.
10. Tax relief for deferred annuity extended

2022 Tax Checklist If you purchased or sold real estate.

What is deductible?

What is NOT deductible?

There are at least a handful of settlement statement line items that are neither deductible, nor can they be added to the property’s basis.

Examples of these items include:
🔥Credit loan charges including credit report fees, appraisal fees and preparation of mortgage note or deed of trust fees
🔥Hazard insurance premiums paid in advance or into the lender’s escrow account
🔥Homeowner’s association dues and condominium dues
Rent for pre-occupancy of home
🔥Charges for utilities

Omni Financial has been in the tax relief industry for over 35 years, so we've seen it all when it comes to tax debt. Here are the top 3 biggest mistakes people make when it comes to their tax debt…and what they should do instead. ⠀
⠀
Instead of: ⠀
❌ Ignoring the tax balance due ⠀
❌ Not opening tax notices ⠀
❌  Randomly making payments here and there ⠀
⠀
Do this instead: ⠀
✅ Call a tax professional for free consultation ⠀
✅ Open tax notices and see if you have appeal rights ⠀
✅ Set up a payment plan because random payments don't prevent a levy action ⠀
⠀

The tax season is officially here! Have you filed your taxes yet? There are still a few days left if you are still looking to reduce your taxable income - here are some types of tax reliefs you can apply for to reduce your personal income tax!

Do you know that fertility treatments such as Intra-Uterine Insemination (IUI) and In-Vitro Fertilisation (IVF) undergone by married couples (taxpayers) in the year 2022 can enjoy up to RM8,000 of income tax relief? This was an initiative by the Malaysian government that acknowledges the fact that almost all medical insurance do not cover fertility treatments and income tax relief for medical expenses is one of the ways to lighten the burden and manage your fertility journey. Want to know how? Find out more information from your fertility clinic and Lembaga Hasil Dalam Negeri Malaysia and take advantage of possible tax savings on your fertility expenses.

This is the reality many families in Warrington face 💔 

Imagine being a single mum of two, forced to make impossible choices every day: a new sofa or food, a new sofa or paying rent, a new sofa or school uniforms for her children.

This mum and her children had no choice but to use a worn and torn sofa because they could barely afford to survive. But thanks to a generous donation, we were able to provide them with a comfortable, clean sofa, bringing some much needed comfort to their home. 🏠 ✨

This is why we do what we do. Every donation counts and makes a real difference 

Your support helps families like hers. Please consider donating today 🙏🏼

Some BTS from our dopamine dressing shoot with @barnardosretail ✨

Fun fact: did you know that “Forever yours, Betty” started as a vintage side hustle? 

I’ve been a collector of all things vintage and colourful since my teens, so by the time I hit college I ended up getting together with some like minded friends to start selling on the side at local fairs and indie shops. 

We had a love for romanticising each item, creating a whole written back story of “Betty”. Each piece shared a snippet more about her, her life, who she was and what she was doing as well as the love and memories she had towards her entire wardrobe. We imagined her not to be selling her wares but more so sharing her stories. And so, Betty was born! 

It would have been fabulous if we knew  someone called Betty wore a dress we had found while sipping a Midouri Sour with the Rocketts at Elizabeth Taylor’s birthday party in 1974, but for us it was all about ✨the fantasy✨ something I still automatically do with every vintage find. It may be fictional, but painting a happy exciting history just adds more fun to the whole second hand experience! 

Be sure to take a snap if you spot me in your local Barnados! So happy to have been asked to join such a colourful and fun bunch of creators to bring this to life!

 Are you a second hand romantic, or a realist?! 🧡👀✨

YESTERDAYS ADVENTURE 

Getting to showcase  @localaidswansea charity shops and my styling ideas for 
  @itvwales & @backstageitv 
Really was the best fun , I still look around the room when I get called a stylist as I don’t expect anyone to be talking about me but to be called a fashion stylist on TV is a massive achievement , I will bang on about that for sometime hahaha !!

As some of you know Charity shopping & thrifting is my favourite thing to do while helping charity’s and being more sustainable  with my choices 

But did you know way back when my twins were little 
this wee charity here in Swansea provided much needed support and respite to me by way of a Saturday club called Buddies where I would drop my twins off, and it would give me a couple of hours free. 
In those days local aid charity shops funded and supported 15 families who had a child or children with additional needs 
Today it provides a club EVERY  evening to 50 families 
This is just one reason why your local charity shops need your donations , your volunteering and your money 
So projects like Buddies and others can continue 

loved every minute doing this with my twin sister and my mates as models 
And guess what you can catch up with this episode soon on ITV Wales  and you can follow @backstageitv for more info 
When this episode will be shown and the digital content that was filmed 

Until then I just want to say a massive thank you to my models @rh11bev who made her dress from a @andreahansford @bowdensimone @life_at_number_20 
And to the super talented fashion designer @ryanrixuk who made me a coat from a blanket for this episode 
( more on that very soon ) 
@wellybob22 

I’ve also decided I’m going to volunteer with Buddies so I can be part of a team which helped me when I needed it way back then

Today is one year since my baby Thistle passed. Rest in peace sweet Thistle. I have not posted on here but I have also been working as a vet tech. Because of you Thistle I started another career helping animals, and I think of this often. Thank you for our short time together and for propelling me into a field I love. Hopefully in the future there will be successful treatments for FIP, its a devastating diagnosis and agonizing to go through. I donated again to The Winn Feline Foundation who funds a bunch of FIP research. Love you little Thistle ❤️ #fuckfip #felineinfectiousperitonitisawareness  #felineinfectiousperitonitis #winnfelinefoundation #fipresearch #endfip

It’s Lacy’s 3 year cure date from FIP. I’m grateful everyday that I have this silly, sassy, snuggle bug in my life. I almost lost her to a horrible disease that we now have the meds for. But the meds are expensive and black market because the fda hasn’t approved it. And because it’s not fda approved, most vets don’t know about the cure, and if they do they can’t recommend the illegal cure for fear of losing their license. Research is still underway and @zenbycat is helping. I would love if the drugs could be made available to everyone that need them. I would also love if there could be a vaccine one day. Please check out @zenbycat and think about becoming a monthly donor to help with the research ❤️🐾🐾 #fipsucks #fipsurvivor #curedoffip #formerferal #fipwarrior #fipresearch #rescuecat

This isn't a fun post to make. In fact, it really sucks. 

If you have been following us since the beginning, you may remember Jupiter. She was a tiny little kitten with deformed front legs that almost froze to death. One of our founders, Mallori, fought HARD to keep her alive for those touch-and-go first 24 hours. After she was stable, she was transferred to Abby, one of our board members with immense veterinary knowledge. At Abby's home, Jupiter was LOVED immensely and became Abby and Family's first "foster fail". Unfortunately, Jupiter had medical problem after medical problem. The decision was ultimately made to let her go peacefully from her suffering. Jupiter's family opted for a necropsy, which is the same thing as an autopsy in humans. Upon examination, doctors were able to determine that Jupiter was suffering from the dry form of FIP. 

We are wanting to compile data to benefit FIP research, starting with our own kitties. If you have previously adopted from us and your cat was diagnosed or suspected to have FIP, please fill out the form located in the LinkTr.ee in our bio called "FIP Data Collection". If you have a cat that was diagnosed with or suspected to have FIP that was not adopted from us, you are also welcome to complete the form. We know that this form may be triggering and difficult to complete, so we thank you WHOLEHEARTEDLY in advance. 

You can learn a lot more about FIP by visiting the LinkTr.ee in our bio and clicking the "Learn More about FIP" link.

Feline infectious peritonitis (FIP) is a viral disease caused by a feline coronavirus that affects wild and domestic cats. This type of coronavirus is different from the coronavirus that causes COVID-19 in people.

Feline coronavirus is very common and usually doesn't cause any serious issues, aside from mild diarrhea. But when the feline coronavirus changes to a specific strain of the coronavirus, FIP can develop. In about 10% of infected cats, the virus will multiply and mutate, resulting in an infection known as feline infectious peritonitis virus (FIPV) that spreads throughout the cat’s body. It can cause an extreme inflammatory reaction in the tissues surrounding the abdomen, kidney, or brain.

[FIP Questionnaire] 🐱🐾 [FIP 問卷]

如你懷疑你的貓患上 FIP，或在治療中，請在連結登入及上載資料，當數量足夠時，系統會嘗試以現有的數據作病情及藥效分析，此調查不能取代臨床檢查，請按時回獸醫覆診。（連結在簡介中）

If you suspect that your cat has or is undergoing treatment for FIP, please log in to the provided link and upload the necessary information. When there is a sufficient amount of data, the system will attempt to analyze the condition and efficacy of the medication based on existing information. However, this survey cannot replace clinical examinations. Please make sure to schedule regular follow-up appointments with your veterinarian. (Link in bio)

𝐍𝐞𝐰 𝐃𝐫𝐮𝐠𝐬 𝐆𝐢𝐯𝐞 𝐚 𝐌𝐢𝐝𝐝𝐥𝐞 𝐂𝐥𝐚𝐰 𝐭𝐨 𝐅𝐞𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐞 𝐈𝐧𝐟𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐮𝐬 𝐏𝐞𝐫𝐢𝐭𝐨𝐧𝐢𝐭𝐢𝐬 (𝐅𝐈𝐏)

 𝗔𝗨𝗦𝗧𝗥𝗔𝗟𝗜𝗔 (Medical) Until recently, FIP was a death sentence for cats. A kitty diagnosed with FIP faced a swift introduction to the Grim Reaper.
Fortunately, 𝒘𝒂𝒔 is now the operative word cuz studies show two new drugs, GS-441524 and remdesivir (known for treating COVID-19), cure over 85% of my fellow felines with FIP.

𝗞𝗲𝘆 𝘀𝘁𝘂𝗱𝘆 𝘁𝗮𝗸𝗲𝗮𝘄𝗮𝘆𝘀:
•	Both GS-441524 and remdesivir are effective and well-tolerated in FIP kitties with a cure rate of 86% at 6 months. Woohoo!
•	Both oral and injectable forms of these drugs are effective.
•	The researchers are still trying to determine the optimal dosages and durations of treatment for FIP. (More on that when they finally figure out the math.)
•	The drugs aren't approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration, so there are legal and ethical issues with using them before vets get the FDA's okey dokey.

𝗢𝗻 𝗮 𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗼𝗻𝗮𝗹 𝗻𝗼𝘁𝗲
 My house companion Pallas died of FIP last year. After it was too late for her, I found a source of the meds: https://maxpawhealth.com/ (No endorsement; just offering a resource.)

𝗥𝗲𝗮𝗱 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗦𝘁𝘂𝗱𝘆
J Vet Intern Med. 2023 Sep-Oct;37(5):1772-1783. doi: 10.1111/jvim.16803. Epub 2023 Jul 13. https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/37439383

Today, I come with sad news. My heart is shattered as I share that my baby has been diagnosed positive for FIP (Feline Infectious Peritonitis). I’ve created a fundraising link for those willing to help. It will be pinned in my bio. The treatment is illegal so, really expensive but offers a chance for survival. This is the only chance. Any contribution means a lot to me... and I’m so sorry for having to post here.
And also, perhaps some of you have gone through the same ordeal and could help me with the steps to follow for treatment or share your experiences.

He has wet FIP with severe symptoms, including abdominal effusion and jaundice. He sleeps a lot, barely moves, and can’t meow. Fluid fills his internal cavities, requiring urgent action. A treatment, albeit illegal and expensive (between 2500 and 8000+ €), may help him survive. We’re facing challenging costs too for daily injections, weekly vet visits, blood tests, and ultrasounds. 

I can’t let my baby go; any support, no matter how small, is deeply appreciated. My other cat, Tokyo, carries the disease dormant, and we hope he remains unaffected. Praying for my bb Kaiju’s recovery.
 
You will live. I love you ❤️‍🩹😢🧸

Wishing a very happy 65th anniversary to our member Greater Moncton SPCA (GM SPCA) in New Brunswick. What a milestone!🎉

Formed in 1955 by a small group of concerned citizens, they wanted something to be done about the stray animals and cruelty towards animals in this area. The following year, @monctonspca was founded. Their mission is to provide and promote high-quality animal care through a commitment to continuous improvement of their services, education, and community programs.

The Greater Moncton SPCA is one of Atlantic Canada's largest animal shelters, taking in more than 2,000 animals each year!

We invite humane societies and SPCAs in Canada to join forces with us by becoming members of Humane Canada™. Learn more at the link in our profile “become a member”.

Happy #RabbitAwarenessWeek!🐇 A week dedicated to bouncing bunnies and resilient rabbits across the world? Sign us up!

Rabbit Awareness Week (RAW) is an annual campaign aiming to educate rabbit owners on all aspects of rabbit care. This year’s theme focuses on rabbits’ environmental welfare.

According to @rabbitatsrescue, our associates, Canadian cities contend with abandoned pets and their feral offspring while rural areas deal with unscrupulous breeders who routinely release their unwanted stock. These domestic rabbits soon become a problem for neighbourhoods forced to deal with environmentally destructive natural behaviour like chewing and burrowing. It’s a tragedy for the loose bunnies as they will most likely be killed by predators, parasites, sport hunters, or trappers hired for ‘pest control’.

Rabbitats is dedicated to providing humane solutions to feral rabbit management by helping build affordable colony housing for sterilized rabbits and educate new rabbit guardians on low maintenance and sustainable care.

#humanecanada #raw #rabbitats #canadianrabbits #canadianbunny #rabbitawareness #rabbitsofcanada #animalsupporters #animalprotection #animaladvocacy

Happy 39th Anniversary to our member society @reginacatrescue! 

Regina Cat Rescue (RCR) devotes their work to helping abandoned cats and kittens and teaches humane education on the treatment of pets. Their mission is to sterilize and care for cats from Regina’s streets, facilitate adoptions and promote responsible pet guardianship.

RCR rescues cats and kittens found on the streets and provides them veterinary care such as spay/neuter surgeries, deworming, identification, vaccination and any rehabilitation necessary for adoption into loving homes. RCR also educates the public on the importance of sterilization, responsible pet care, and the benefits of well-maintained community cat colonies.

Cheers to the RCR Team! Keep up the great work 🎉

All of us at some point would have observed how happy langurs are in their troops ( as they are called). Jumping, swaying, playing enjoying life to the fullest.

We wonder what could ever get anyone to tie these sentient beings !!
What joy would that give humans !!
What do humans want to prove !!

According to The Wildlife Protection Act, 1972, the langur is a protected species under Schedule II and under the IPC Sections 2, 8, 9, 11, 40, 41, 43, 48, 51, 61, and 62. According to these sections, langurs cannot be owned, traded, bought, sold or hired out. Any violation of this law is liable to a three-year jail term or fine or both.

Not just  langurs, let's not allow any animal to be abused...let's make sure the world becomes a safer place for them too...

HELP US...HELP THEM...
.
.
.
.

Good boys! 🎾🦴

Did you know that India has an approximate stray population of 35 - 40 million dogs.
Out of which Hyderabad has around 4.61 lakh strays.
Did you also know that a female dog on an average can  have around 3 litters a year; from 6 months of age, till they are around 11 years. 
Did you know that with an average litter size of around 4 puppies, each female dog can give birth to around 12-15 puppies a year, on an average.

The only way to control this and help them is through the Animal Birth Control Program ( ABC program). Please inform GHMC of dogs in your area that need to be sterilized. 
The dogs will be sterilized and released back in the same area.

A 'V' mark on the ear, indicates the dog has been sterilized. So look out for dogs that need to be sterilized...help control the population..help control the hunger and the related anxiety...help peaceful and healthy co-existence.

Contact GHMC for pick ups in your area NOW...
PFA covers only limited areas...

Thank you for the shoutout! Posted @withregram • @humanecanada Happy International Rabbit Day!

We’re highlighting the excellent work of our associate member, @rabbitatsrescue . A 100% volunteer-run charity dedicated to rescuing abandoned and feral rabbits. Leave them a ❤️ to show your support and gratitude! 

According to Rabbitats, Canadian cities clash with abandoned pets and their feral offspring while rural areas deal with unscrupulous breeders who routinely release their unwanted stock. It’s a tragedy for the loose bunnies as they will most likely be killed by predators, parasites, sport hunters or trappers hired for ‘pest control’. Rabbitats is dedicated to providing humane solutions to feral rabbit management by helping build affordable colony housing for sterilized rabbits and educate new rabbit guardians on low maintenance and sustainable care.

Special shoutout to all the amazing volunteers for their hard work and dedication to helping rabbits in need!

I HAVE FOUND AN INJURED BIRD, WHAT DO I DO !!

For most injured birds, place them gently in a box and keep them quiet, dark and cool. It may be that the bird is in shock and will soon recover so you can let it go.

 If it is more seriously injured, this will reduce stress on the bird until you can get advice on how you can help it.

Birds will usually be more comfortable with their wings held against their bodies, feet supported. 

Small birds: Can be firmly held in one hand, positioning the hand over the bird so that its head is between your fore and middle fingers, letting the rest of your fingers naturally wrap around the wings.

Medium birds: Use two hands, each covering a wing and a soft cloth to hold it.

Large birds: It is best to call an expert rescuer as larger birds are capable of inflicting some damage to anyone trying to handle them. 

Choose an adequately sized box so that the bird can move around, line it with tissues, and make sure it has a cover and air holes. Keeping the bird in the dark helps reduce stress, and a source of heat can help with shock. You can wrap a hot water bottle in a towel and place it inside or next to the box, making sure the bird can get away from the heat if it wants to. If it begins to pant, remove the heat source immediately. 

Don’t offer food or water without being advised by an expert to do so.

Freedom is always precious and so is life...give them the life they are meant to live....

BRING THEM INSIDE IT IS COLD.
🐾🐾

If you are feeling cold with layers of clothing on inside your house...imagine how cold it is for animals left outside without any shelter? 

Please report animals that are left out in the cold without shelter to your local SPCA. Your details will remain anonymous if necessary. 
Details of your local SPCA can be found on our website under the 'locate' icon - www.nspca.co.za 

Animals that can be brought indoors during this cold front should be brought in. Farm animals also have their own unique requirements that must be considered when it gets cold.
@nspca.rsa

Happy #RabbitAwarenessWeek! A week dedicated to bouncing bunnies and resilient rabbits across the world? Sign us up!

Rabbit Awareness Week is an annual campaign to educate rabbit guardians on all aspects of rabbit care. This year’s theme is Neutering: Protect and Prevent.

According to our associate @rabbitatsrescue, Canadian cities contend with abandoned pets and their feral offspring, while rural areas deal with unscrupulous breeders who routinely release their unwanted stock. It’s a tragedy for the loose bunnies as they will most likely be killed by predators, parasites, sport hunters, or trappers hired for ‘pest control.’ 

Rabbitats is working to educate new rabbit guardians on low-maintenance and sustainable care, and you can learn more about rabbit care on their page!

#humanecanada #raw #rabbitats #canadianrabbits #canadianbunny
#rabbitawareness #rabbitsofcanada #animalsupporters #animalprotection #animaladvocacy

Here is the story of Scooby... A 9 year old indie rescue...
Scooby was rescued by PFA a few years ago and is being fostered by a magnanimous staff member.
Having been through, what she has.. she plays mother to many rescues that need that warmth and care, so much so that she even starts lactating, if the little ones suckle her.
She has been mother to not just pups and kittens but even baby squirrels and many more rescues ..
When they can support each other, can't we !!!
Worth a thought - Agree !!!
Let's all do our bit, in making this 'OUR PLANET'....

Evening you lovely people. 
It’s a bit of a different post from me tonight. 
I’m sure most of you have seen or heard about the horrendous video of @kurtzouma abusing his cat. 
I made the mistake of reading the news before I went to bed last night and I was so upset and sickened that I couldn’t sleep. 
It has been on my mind all day today and I feel so sad and frustrated that I can’t do anything. 
In my opinion it is a true privilege to have a pet and the unconditional love they give us is beyond compare. 
I am so disappointed that @westham still decided to play him tonight. 
There have been so many campaigns over the years to get abuse out of football whether it be by online trolling, racial slurs or actual physical violence in the form of throwing objects onto the pitch. But how can the clubs continue to campaign about any sort of abuse  when it still puts a player who has abused his cat in the team? 
Just as abuse isn’t tolerated on or off the pitch for players neither should it be if they are the ones inflicting it! 
ABUSE IS ABUSE and anyone who abuses an innocent animal is the lowest of the low in my opinion. 
So I’m asking any of you lovely followers who feel the same to sign the change.org petition to have him prosecuted and his beautiful cats taken away from him. @rickygervais @rspca_official @metpolice_uk @adidasfootball @bbcfootball @skysports @chrisgpackham2 @dominic_dyer1970 @gmb @thismorning @skynews @bbcnews #cats cats #catlover #stopabuse #oneruleforthem #catsofinstagram #animallovers #animalsupporters #notocruelty #abusers #petlovers #petloversofinstagram #bekind #kindnessmatters #animalsarebetterthanpeople #animalsarethebest #animalsarefamily

🇺🇸This Veterans Day week, as we reflect on the selflessness of those who've worn our nation's uniform, we are proud to share a heartfelt project from @swoffordcareercenter.  Under the guidance of Instructor Jared Duncan, welding students have utilized their skills to build beautiful benches for The Wall That Heals, currently at the Spartanburg Airport until Sunday at 2 pm.

We encourage you to visit The Wall That Heals and invite you to take a moment of rest on these benches to remember and appreciate the sacrifices made by our brave men and women in uniform, and their families.  Let the reflection spot offer you a place to connect with history and with our community's gratitude.  It's a rare opportunity to be a part of something so meaningful - a wall that heals, and indeed, a wall that teaches. ❤️

We want to give a big thank you to the Veterinary Students of Puerto Rico (@vetstudentspr) from Ross University School of Veterinary Medicine for a surprise generous donation we received. In the first few months of 2020, they came together to raise funds for Puerto Rico’s earthquakes and Australia’s bushfires. We are honored that they chose us to be a recipient of their efforts: "The students and faculty from Puerto Rico at RUSVM mobilized our community soon after the disaster events, in an effort to raise funds to assist with relief efforts for animals in the affected areas.  The students decided to donate the monies to your organization, as it proves to be one that year after year continues to provide a holistic approach to improving animal welfare in Puerto Rico." Thank you so much to each and everyone of these students for their advocacy on behalf of the animals in Puerto Rico (and around the world) and for helping us save more lives.

Before winter break began for us, we completed a class book drive to donate books for the holidays to another class in our district. I wanted to find a way to combine a service project with teaching my students the life skill of wrapping gifts. 🎁 My students and their families were able to donate over 100 (gently used or new) books that were able to be given out to more than our intended class! My students wrote a note to the reader inside of each book before wrapping them up. I loved seeing my students and their families come together to help make the holiday season a bit brighter for some other students. 🤍

Ashland University’s 5th annual FitFest…a day of exercise and education while supporting pediatric cancer families!!!

A Visit to a Nursing Home

Our students and school administration at Ishik Duhok International Boys' Secondary School recently visited a local nursing home to spread some joy and show their appreciation for the residents and staff. They were welcomed by the manager, Mr. Saadi, who gave them a warm tour of the facility.

Our students brought gifts for the residents, who were thrilled to receive the gifts, and there were many smiles and hugs to go around.

We are grateful for the opportunity to have visited the nursing home, and we hope to return soon.
----------

سەردانێک بۆ خانەی بەساڵاچووان

قوتابییەکانمان و کارگێڕی قوتابخانەی ئیشقی دهۆکی ماسیکی بنەڕەتی نێودەوڵەتیمان لەم دواییانەدا سەردانی خانەی بەساڵاچووانیان کرد بۆ بڵاوکردنەوەی هەندێک خۆشی و نیشاندانی پێزانینی خۆیان بۆ بەتەمەنەکان و ستافەکە. لەلایەن بەڕێوەبەر کاک سەعدی پێشوازییان لێکرا و پێکە بەناو خانەکەدا گەڕان.

قوتابییەکانمان هەندێک دیارییان پێشکەشکردن، و ئەوانیش دڵخۆش بوون بە دیارییەکان، و کاتێکی خۆشیان بەسەربرد.

سوپاسگوزارین بۆ ئەو دەرفەتەی کە سەردانی خانەی بەساڵاچووانمان کردووە، هیوادارین بەم زووانە بگەڕێینەوە.
----------

زيارة إلى دار رعاية المسنين

قام طلابنا وإدارة المدرسة في مدرسة عشق دهوك الثانوية الدولية للبنين مؤخرًا بزيارة دار رعاية محلية لنشر بعض الفرح وإظهار تقديرهم للمقيمين والموظفين. تم استقبالهم بحفاوة من قبل المدير، السيد سعدي، الذي قدم لهم جولة دافئة في المنشأة.

قدم طلابنا هدايا للمقيمين، الذين كانوا سعداء بتلقي الهدايا، وكان هناك الكثير من الابتسامات والأحضان.

نحن ممتنون لإتاحة الفرصة لنا لزيارة دار رعاية المسنين، ونأمل أن نعود قريبًا.

🌟 Spreading Love and Empathy 🌟

I couldn't be prouder of the amazing students at the @schools! This was a while back when they had the incredible opportunity to visit the local old age home and make a positive impact in the lives of our elderly community members. Witnessing their empathy and compassion firsthand fills my heart with joy! ❤️

These young hearts spent the day spreading love and happiness by feeding the elderly residents, engaging in heartwarming conversations, and brightening up their day. It's truly inspiring to see how our students have embraced the value of empathy, understanding, and respect for all generations.

I believe that instilling such qualities in our future leaders is essential, and these children are shining examples of compassion in action. By encouraging them to be kind and caring individuals, we are fostering a generation that will make a significant difference in the world.

Let's continue to inspire and empower our children to become responsible and empathetic citizens. Together, we can make the world a brighter place for everyone! 🌎✨

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) received nearly 90% of all corporate donations in the financial year 2022-23, a report by Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR) revealed ahead of the Supreme Court’s verdict declaring the electoral bond scheme as unconstitutional today.

According to the election watchdog’s report, while other national political parties reported a combined corporate donation of nearly Rs 70 crore, the BJP received Rs 610.491 crore from the sector.

ADR’s report also highlighted the total donations declared by the national parties for 2022-23, a total of Rs 850.438 crore, of which Rs 719.858 crore went to the BJP alone.

The total donations declared by the BJP are five times more than the total donations declared by Congress, Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), Communist Party of India or CPI(M) and National People’s Party (NPP) for the same period, the report said.

The ADR report is based on donations above Rs 20,000, received by the national political parties during the financial year 2022-23, as per details submitted by the parties to the Election Commission of India (EC).

Read more at thewire.in

For nearly a year, Al Otro Lado, in collaboration with other organizations, mutual aid groups and selfless volunteers have been providing critical humanitarian relief to refugees at the open-air detention sites in Eastern San Diego County. They are being held by Border Patrol without food, water, shelter or medical assistance. We will continue this work for as long as this takes, but we can’t do it without you! 

This Saturday, we will be hosting a donation drive to support the hundreds of refugees trapped at these sites. By donating essential items, you can make a significant difference in the lives of those in need!  

Date: Saturday, June 1st
Time: 2:00 PM - 4:00 PM
Location: Balboa Park, 6th Ave and Balboa Drive, San Diego 
Look for the Al Otro Lado Tent

When still only a small baby, he travelled from his home town to a distant place... It was not a pleasant trip, in particular because his mother wasn’t with  him. The journey ended at a new home: a building with many windows and strange people. Inside, he joined his new brothers and sisters and a different sort of life began for him. That day, he was just 14 weeks old. Ten months later he was confirmed as being HIV-positive. 

Children born to HIV-positive mothers have a much higher risk than others of being abandoned at or soon after birth. We have 30 children in Mexico, 1 infant in Mexico and 19 infants in Tanzania - all HIV positive - who need school sponsors so we can send them to school. All have been abandoned by their families. 

Are you interested in sponsoring? If yes, send me a message. Your donation is tax deductible 😊

Can’t believe I can start counting down in weeks! Sooner than you think I’ll be counting down in days… 

So excited to be running both of these marathons this year. It’s going to be incredible. 

Chicago will be my 2nd ever full marathon and I’m so excited to be running BOTH with Children’s Tumor Foundation. 

Not only do I run with them because I have NF2-SWN, but because their goal is to help for research to find a cure for ALL types of NF!

With this cure, no one else would have to wonder when their next surgery is, what the next treatment is going to be, when will a new side effect pop up… No one deserves that. 

And that’s why I run. I’m looking to raise $5,000 towards this goal. I’m just a little over halfway there. It would be so greatly appreciated if you could find it in your hearts to donate and support this cause 💙💚

Thank you!

On Sunday, June 2, the Diocese of Covington will launch the Campaign of Mercy, which will provide a basis for all of us to grow in our faith and connect with others.

Kicking off the Campaign of Mercy on the Feast of Corpus Christi demonstrates the connectedness of the Eucharist — Jesus’ invitation to share in his sacrificial love through serving others.

Join us at 2 p.m. on Sunday at the Cathedral Basilica of the Assumption as we celebrate this launch and move toward a deeper, more loving relationship with Christ and a more loving and joyful life.

#Saudi Arabia’s Prince, #mohammadbinsalman, issued an order banning #Iftars in #mosques ahead of Ramadan, tentatively slated to begin on March 11 and conclude by April 9 this year.
Saudi Arabia’s Ministry of #Islamic Affairs issued a set of instructions for mosque employees to follow during the month of Ramadan in an order dated February 20, 2024. The Ministry also issued orders restricting imams and muezzins from collecting financial #donations for organising iftar feasts. The Islamic Affairs Ministry of Saudi Arabia also imposed a ban on organising iftar feasts inside the mosques, raising concerns regarding cleanliness.

In a post on X (formerly Twitter), the caption to the notice read, “The #Ministry_of_Islamic_Affairs, Dawah and Guidance issues a number of instructions related to mosques during the blessed month of #Ramadan 1445 AH.”

The order stated, “Imams and muezzins in various regions of the Kingdom not to collect financial donations for Iftar projects for fasting people and others.”

The notice, raising issues about #cleanliness being compromised when iftar feasts are held inside mosques, directed imam and muezzin to oversee the organisation of these feasts in mosques’ courtyards and charged them with the responsibility to ensure cleanliness soon after the feast concludes.

The Ministry’s notice stated, “Iftar projects should not be held inside mosques due to concerns about cleanliness, so an appropriate place should be prepared in the mosques’ courtyards without the use of temporary rooms, tents, or the like, and that Iftar should be under the imam’s and muezzin’s responsibility, with the obligation of the one who breaks the fast to clean the place immediately after finishing food.”

Moreover, the Ministry discouraged using cameras inside the mosque premises, stating that they should not be used to record the imam and worshippers offering namaz, as this undermines worshippers’ reverence. The Ministry also issued orders that prayers should not be broadcast on media of any kind, including social media.

Week 190: 02/06/24: This week we @food_fuelforfaith gave away sanitary pads to the female workers in and around our society. 

“Menstrual hygiene is a necessity, not a luxury”.

Talking about menstruation is a taboo in most societies, and this contributes to the ignorance and illiteracy on menstrual hygiene management. Economic status, socio-cultural beliefs and lack of sufficient menstrual awareness are contributors to the lower prevalence of women using sanitary napkins for periods. Taking care of yourself during menstruation is as important as taking care of your day to day activities. A little negligence in menstrual hygiene management can cause your body grievous harm, and you may also act as an instrument for the spread of infection to others. Please spread a word for us @vediika__ @mau.urya @niyomishah__ and make this grow. Thank you all for the support🙏

Dr. Mark and Cindy Lynn have a reputation for using their passion — and checkbook — to make Louisville a better place. Over the years, they’ve contributed to more than three dozen causes throughout the city, the largest and most obvious being the four-year-old soccer stadium. But some of their impactful work may be felt more intimately through organizations like local 4H groups, Blessings in a Backpack, and Vision Impairment Preschool Services. They often put their resources behind philanthropic work related to children’s issues and development to improve the community for the next generation. 

This year they’ve added a new cause to the portfolio. Mark and Cindy are co-chairs of Norton Healthcare’s recently announced “Just Imagine” campaign and will lead a $200 million fundraising effort over two years aimed at increasing access to healthcare, bringing in world-class physicians, and pushing for research that improves the quality of life. As co-chairs, the Lynns will connect the campaign to business and community leaders and lead by example as they donate to the cause.

Norton and the Lynns are hoping for big things with the "Just Imagine" campaign.

Read more about them by visiting the link in our bio.
📝: @maggiemenderski / The Courier Journal

🤑 The poor are more generous than the rich when it comes to giving to good causes, according to research that challenges the "Robin Hood" myth of charity as an agent of redistribution.⁠
A study published in 2001 found that the least well-off give a higher proportion of their income to charity than the wealthy, no matter what their age, class, or beliefs.⁠
⁠
The conclusion flies in the face of the traditional image of the most generous givers as being middle-aged, middle-class religious women living in the southeast of England. While the rich may be giving more in absolute terms, people on lower incomes are putting a higher percentage of their cash in collection boxes.⁠
⁠
_____⁠
⁠
📰 The report, titled 'The Widow's Might: How Charities Depend on The Poor,' also argued that charities are not necessarily the engines of redistribution from rich to poor that they are widely believed to be.⁠
Many charities - such as those supporting education or the arts - do not help the most needy, the study says. It accuses the charitable sector of giving a "misleading" impression of alleviating poverty in order to secure tax breaks and voluntary support.⁠
⁠
_____⁠
⁠
🔗 Source: Link in our bio. A full list of references is also available at: linkin.bio/ig-facts⁠

In an act of love befitting Valentine’s Day, local philanthropists @garymhess and @trevor.burgess.94 have made a $1 million gift to the @st.petersburgfreeclinic, and now they’re challenging the community to match the donation.

Today, the St. Petersburg Free Clinic announced the Burgess-Hess million-dollar gift and challenge that will help provide vital support for the important work of SPFC. The Free Clinic’s wide-reaching work in Pinellas County provides health care, nutritious food, recovery housing, and education for our neighbors in need. With this gift, Burgess and Hess are asking locals to match the charitable support so that SPFC can continue and build upon its crucial work.

As SPFC notes, the need for support in St. Pete and Pinellas County has actually increased by more than 50% over the last few years as so many individuals and families in the area struggle to keep up with the soaring cost of living. 

Full story for #ilovetheburg by Bob Carskadon at the link in our bio.

Today, on what would have been my sister Ashley Gross’s 38th birthday, my Dad got to see the impact of his generous donation to our (3 Gross sisters) old high school, Dickinson. Thanks to his contribution, the entire soccer team received brand new uniforms and warm-up gear, and a beautiful mural was painted on the school wall.

In a touching tribute, my dad was presented with Ashley’s old jersey, #6, which will now hang in the halls of the school, ensuring her spirit lives on. Ashley was one of a kind—insanely smart, spunky, hysterical, and kind-hearted. She dreamed of having as many children as God would allow, though she passed away before having any of her own. Now, her memory will be surrounded by the kids at Dickinson, and even if they don’t know her entire story, her legacy will continue to inspire and live on. 🦋

Saviez-vous que le Musée Beaulne reçoit encore des dons régulièrement ? 🤔
Alors, qu’est-ce qu’on catalogue au Musée Beaulne cette semaine ?

Voici une belle collection en don de Monsieur Jacques Landry qui seront séparés en lot et particulièrement par matériaux, souvenirs et provenance pour ensuite être catalogués, et rangés dans la réserve appropriée. 
☆glissez vers la gauche afin de voir les autres photos 😁

Un dé à coudre est un petit objet dans lequel on insère le bout du doigt pour le protéger de l'aiguille à coudre, généralement le majeur ou l'annulaire. Le dé à coudre est un des plus vieux objets au monde et reste encore aujourd’hui fabriqué un peu partout dans le monde. Il est de plus devenu un objet de collection, et moins un outil de couture. 

Did you know that the Beaulne Museum still receives donations regularly?🤔
And, what are we cataloging at the Beaulne Museum this week?

Here is a beautiful collection donated by Mr. Jacques Landry which will be separated into lots and particularly by materials, souvenirs and provenance to then be catalogued and placed in the appropriate storage room.
A thimble is a small object into which the tip of the finger is inserted to protect it from the sewing needle, usually the middle or ring finger. The thimble is one of the oldest objects in the world and is still made all over the world today. It has become more of a collector's item, and less of a sewing tool.

The spirit of giving is alive and well in St. Joseph, with support being extended to the community's youth. 

Recently, the graduating students of the St. Elizabeth Primary School were presented with a cheque to support them as they transition to secondary school. 

The Bursary Award, which will be granted annually, was presented by brothers Anson and Lawrence Eastmond, who currently reside in Toronto and New York respectively. 

The award is in honour of their mother Gertrude Eastmond-Welch of Cleavers Hill, who passed away on April 1, 2024, at the age of 95. 

Ms. Eastmond-Welch attended the old St. Elizabeth School as a child. 

Senior Teacher at the school, Richard Browne, received the cheque on behalf of the students.

✨ FROM THE RIVER TO THE SEA ✨

L’essere umano non ha una vita semplice. Per sopravvivere andiamo in terapia, assumiamo farmaci, dormiamo. Ma la terapia non ci salva dalla sofferenza del mondo. Non cancella il senso di impotenza che proviamo. Ho cercato di capire cosa posso fare, nel mio piccolo, per dare una mano, ho letto articoli, ho letto post e così ho pensato di diffondere le informazioni che ho trovato utili e di fare anche io qualcosa.

✨ non stare più in silenzio. Diffondere profili che possano far capire alle persone che non è vero quello che ci arriva tramite i canali “ufficiali” come giornali o tg. 

✨ provare a boicottare i marchi che sostengono Isr43le
( a questo proposito, grazie a un mio collega che mi ha informato, ho iniziato a proporre un’altra crema per la cura dei tatuaggi perché la precedente apparteneva a uno di queste aziende). 

A questo proposito trovate un post utili su @nojusticenopeace_italy 

✨ sostenere le iniziative che cercano di aiutare il popolo pal. 

A questo proposito, ho fatto l’unica cosa che so fare: disegnare. Ho realizzato un’illustrazione che potete acquistare e che riceverete in file digitale tramite email una volta effettuato il pagamento (a partire da 10€ ma potete fare qualunque offerta) e il ricavato aiuterà alcune famiglie pal che la community di  @watermelonfriendsit , composta da volontar*, sta cercando di salvare. 

Appena raccolta una minima somma, certificherò l’avvenuta donazione.

Non lo so se funzionerà questa cosa ma se anche riusciremo a donare qualcosa, per me sarà bello aver provato a fare qualcosa di utile. 

Io l’ho fatto acquistando un’illustrazione di un’altra ragazza. Sono piccole azioni ma l’arte ogni tanto può dare una mano.

Grazie ❤️

✨ INFO IN DM ✨

This year, Via Margutta joined the @internazionalibnlditalia in an innovative way, with the surrealist setup of a large tennis court at Piazza del Popolo. 

As a continuation of this conjugation between art and sport, thanks to the @_federtennis and #albertosacco I donated an artwork to @janniksin, on behalf of the @gallerialanuvola, spokesperson of the @viamargutta_associazione, thanks to the support of President #graziamarino, who made this possible. 

The creation was created by @leonardoscotti_art, a stamping and rampant contemporary artist.
It is a tribute to sport, art and the rules that compose it, which in part resemble those that concern our existence. 

The work created with various mixed techniques, composed of spray paints, enamels, acrylic, oil and epoxy resin, is dedicated to Sinner, today an icon of tennis and a profile of our time.
I thank all the members of the @viamargutta_associazione with whom we will create new connections!

CWC Year 4 Fellow Khloe @khloe_taylor_thompson is attending CCA’s pre-college program @cacollegeofarts this summer in San Francisco!

Since she was just 8 years old, Khloe has been captivated by the world of fashion design. Fueled by her grandmother’s exceptional sewing skills, Khloe’s passion for creating clothes blossomed. 

“As an artist, I’m inspired by anything. Anything I see can make me want to create an illustration. I love creating dresses, even sketching a dress you can make shapes and change the overall look of how it will appear on the body. I think the illusion of garments is what I totally love.”

Khloe founded a nonprofit organization (Khloe Kares) supporting women experiencing homelessness. She is passionate about philanthropy having raised funds to build water pumps in Ghanaian schools without access to clean water.

Inspired by artists who merge different eras, such as Michael Wilkinson, the costume designer for “Jingle Jangle,” Khloe is fascinated by the fusion of Afro-Victorian styles with contemporary patterns and colors. She draws inspiration from African fashion, embracing its vibrant patterns and cultural significance.
 
Please read our blog post highlighting Khloe and the other fellows attending CCA pre-college this summer.

Seattle University has received the largest art donation ever given to a university. So large, in fact, the Jesuit school will have to build a new museum to house the $300 million collection.

The donation, from 88-year-old real estate developer Richard “Dick” Hedreen, includes $25 million seed money to create the Seattle University Museum of Art on the school's Capitol Hill campus.

University President Eduardo Peñalver called the donation “transformational.”

“The collection is remarkable because it spans six centuries of art history,” Peñalver said. “It goes back to the early Renaissance, includes great masters and contemporary art. And it has a significant [amount] of sacred art, which fits especially well with Seattle University’s Jesuit tradition. So, it’s a perfect collection for building a new museum.”

To read the full story, tap the link in bio.

The piece is one of many among the donated collection. Another amazing milestone has been reached by South West Blood Bikes in 2024, over 40,000 items have been collected, transported and delivered by our fantastic, dedicated  volunteers, who give so much of their time to help others in the communities they live and work in!

These items have all been transported on behalf of the NHS and other Medical Facilities in Devon since the charity began in 2018, all completely FREE of charge! The items range from whole blood, blood & other biological samples, patient notes, medication, medical equipment and even donor breast milk for premature babies.

We do not receive any funding from the NHS or its patients for this service, it is run entirely on the generous donations from the general public, community groups, local businesses, volunteer fundraising and some grant funding. Every penny donated goes towards keeping the charity operational. Everyone in the charity is a VOLUNTEER and we have NO paid staff.

Please help us continue to be able to provide this service for many years to come an by using the donate link below. Please remember to tick the Gift Aid box if you are eligible, every penny really does make a difference.

Thank you ❤

https://www.paypal.com/gb/fundraiser/charity/4147851

Spent our Sunday afternoon in the most fulfilling way – collecting bottles for upcycling! 

We collect glass bottle waste from the incredible community that The Upcycle Project has built over the years. While we look forward to expanding to local restaurants and bars as the venture grows, there’s something truly special about connecting with individuals who share our passion for sustainability. 

Grateful for the generous donations from a community member who’s now become a friend – this is the second load they’ve contributed! It’s heartwarming to encounter others deeply invested in environmental care. 

Together, we’re making a difference, one bottle at a time. ♻️

💚Wir brauchen eure Hilfe!

🙏Unsere gemeinnützige Organisation steht vor großen Herausforderungen durch Inflation, sinkende Mitgliederzahlen und Nachhaltigkeitsgeschäfte, die schließen. Das hat zu einem erheblichen Einnahmerückgang geführt. Wir brauchen eure Unterstützung, um effektiv weiterarbeiten zu können! Wenn eine Mitgliedschaft keine Option für dich ist, freuen wir uns über eine Spende – jeder Euro zählt! 🙏

👉Was passiert mit deiner Spende für Zero Waste Austria?👈

☀️Wir arbeiten zu einem Großteil ehrenamtlich und beziehen unsere Einnahmen aus Mitgliedschaften, Projekten oder Workshops und Vorträgen. Trotzdem ist ein Großteil unserer Arbeit unbezahlt.

🌱Wenn du als Privatperson oder Unternehmen eine Spende durchführen möchtest, kannst du dies einerseits über unsere Zero Waste Austria Mitgliedschaften und andererseits über unser Spendenformular auf der Website tun. Das geht ganz einfach und hilft uns enorm, unsere Arbeit fortzuführen! Bei Abschluss einer Mitgliedschaft erhältst du außerdem tolle Gegenleistungen.

💚Mit deiner Spende unterstützt du uns weiter an unserem Projekt Zero Waste Austria zu arbeiten. Wir freuen uns über jeden finanziellen Beitrag, der zu 100% in unsere Arbeit fließt.

👉Außerdem: ab einer Spende von 10 € gibt es als Dankeschön den Zero Waste Guide dazu.

#zerowasteaustria #zerowaste #spenden #donate #donation

🔴🔴 I have to share about a heartbreaking story from Gaza : 🙏🙏
 It is about the father of Yamen Madi, a little 10 years old boy from Gaza that was badly injured by an Israeli AIRSTRIKE while he was playing near the house and got SHRAPNELS on stomach intestine colon and his lower limbs and left hand. He stayed one month in hospital in Gaza and his treatment didn't succeed. After many efforts he was evaluated. 
 Yamen was safely evacuated to Egypt to get suitable treatment for his critical case along with his mother and two siblings. And now they are in Qatar because Yamen will do an other surgery there.
💔 But the father couldn't travel with them and is stuck in Gaza because they don't allow fathers as companion.
 Yamen's father and with shattered heart is seeking our support so he can join the family.
⚠️⚠️ He survived from DEATH in Rafah and displaced an other time to Deer El Balah.
⚠️⚠️⚠️ Time is running out and the father myst be with his family as soon as possible. He's their breadwinner and the whole family depends on him.
⚠️⚠️ The amount of money that should be collected to get the father out is 5000$. 

Yamen needs his father and has the right to find him by his side.‼️‼️‼️

SICK BUNNY FUND - Donations needed for a big vet week (stay tuned for diagnostics). A small army of buns assessed yesterday. We have a large population of senior buns at our sanctuary, many coming with complex medical treatments. Several rabbits needed eye problems assessed, with conditions ranging from minor to possible glaucoma. 

Donations are appreciated for upcoming procedures, as well as medical fosters for more intensive care needs. Rabbitats.org/foster Donations to paypal.com/ca/fundraiser/charity/3764772 or rabbitats.org/donate 

Other vet visits include a neuter and suture removal. 

Finally, we are sad to report that our sweet Cappy was put to sleep last week. He had so many medical problems in spite of everything we tried. He was much older than we originally thought and struggling …we are grateful we were able to try. 💕

PLEASE HELP US FEED THE SHELTER CATS 🙏🏼

We are humbly appealing for donations so we can purchase cat food to replenish our dwindling stock. 

For every 1 dog in the shelter, there are 6 cats to feed; and with the responsibility of caring for over 200 rescued animals, our beloved cats and dogs consume ~1000 kilos of dry kibble each month, totaling around P150,000 in expenses.

Your generous support will directly and greatly help the lives of our shelter animals. If you are unable to donate, sharing this post would be an immense help to us in itself. 

HOW TO DONATE:

💚 GCASH
• Scan the QR code in the photo
• Or you can also go to “Bills Payment”, then search for “Philippine Animal Welfare Society”

💚 BANK TRANSFER
Account Name: The Philippine Animal Welfare Society

• BPI (Swift no. BOPIPHMM)
- PHP Acct No. 3943-0086-11
- USD Acct No. 3944-0021-61

• BPI eDonate: https://bpiedonate.com/paws

• PNB (Swift no. PNBM PHMM)
-Acct No. 1888-70015305

• BDO (Savings)
- Acct No : 0076-4800-5860 

• Checks: Please issue to The Philippine Animal Welfare Society, Inc.

💚 US Donations: www.every.org/pawsphilippines
*note: your donation is tax-deductible

Monetary donations would be highly appreciated as it allows us to purchase food in bulk, and each cat area has vet-recommended food depending on their specific medical needs. But if you would like to donate in-kind, please contact us so we can advise you about these specific vet-recommended food. The PAWS Shelter is also open to receive your donations from Mondays to Saturdays (except Wednesdays) from 8AM-5PM.

Your support is invaluable and deeply appreciated. Thank you for considering our shelter cats and our cause!

⁠

⁠
Foundation members expressed frustration over the lack of transparency and vetting processes for such a significant donation.

TWC is experiencing a shortage of greenery vital to the recovery of wild patients.

Sick foxes, injured owls and more… they need small or large trimmings/branches of native trees like oak, maple, birch, ash, willow, apple, cedar, or pine, as well as leaf litter to enrich their temporary homes. Use of this greenery is important for mimicking their natural habitats (allowing patients to climb, peck or perch) and provides places for animals to hide while in care.

If you’re able to donate, or if you have any questions, please call our Donations Team at (416) 631-0662 ext. 3207 or email donations@torontowildlifecentre.com to make arrangements for drop-off (unfortunately we are unable to offer pick-up services) at our Downsview Park location. Thank you!

Zooh Corner Rabbit Rescue

Still need $889 to meet our $1500 

Fundraiser ends tomorrow at midnight!

Noël, seen here, had another massive seizure last night. She is OK now, and being seen again tomorrow and reassessed. 

Noël is just one of many very special Sanctuary Rabbits cared for by Zooh Corner, and the reason we need to make our goal every month. These funds cover all of our basic veterinary visits, all of our overhead - pretty much everything except emergencies.

We did not make goal last month. We have not made goal several times this year. We cannot continue without funds.

Please consider a donation of any size to help us meet our goal of $1500 this month.

Noël and all of thr other Sanctuary, Rabbits, and we humans who care for them, are grateful for every penny that comes our way. ♥️🐰♥️

Hi everyone! Commissions are open aswell if you’d like to comment or dm me for inquiries.

Today and recently has been very hard on us, especially for money, and life situations 
One situation in particular is my sister’s chameleon Pickle, becoming suddenly Egg-Bound (I think that’s the term for our situation) 

Pickle’s leg has become swollen aswell, we assume from her current situation. 
She has a lay bin and proper husbandry. We have been providing her calcium dusted crickets at appropriate times (feeding times) and even have tried to give her extra water because she needs to stay hydrated and seems to be too weak right now to get to her water dish.

We NEED help. 
Specifically help TO SAVE HER LIFE.

Pickle is in desperate need of help from a vet. Which we would have been able to afford before the bills came up and my water heater broke in the house AND my moms tire completely flattened on her car (had to buy new tire) aswell as my mom’s car radiator breaking or whatever too so ermmmm

Thank you so much for taking your time to read this. Shares or even donations would mean the world to me as I cannot imagine life without my sister’s Chameleon.

Begitu banyak harta di dunia ini, tetapi sejatinya kekayaan sejati datang dari hati yang dermawan. Inilah kisah luar biasa Adit Prayoga, pendiri Rumah Makan Gratis di Ciangsana, Bogor.

Adit Prayoga memulai dengan hanya menyediakan 20 porsi makanan gratis setiap hari. Namun sekarang, ribuan porsi makanan bisa dibagikan setiap harinya kepada mereka yang membutuhkan. Dalam keterbatasan ekonomi, Adit tak pernah berhenti berbagi.

Kini, Adit telah memiliki enam Rumah Makan Gratis yang tersebar di wilayah Bogor, Depok, Bekasi, dan Jakarta. Menggunakan uang pribadinya, Adit dan istrinya menghadirkan kebaikan dalam hidup warga sekitar.

Kisah yang begitu menginspirasi ya, Sahabat. Semoga bukan hanya pak Adit Prayoga dan istri, tapi akan ada lebih banyak orang baik lagi yang terus bersemangat menebar kebaikan.

-----

✨The Giveaway✨

THE ESSENCE
The Giveaway is the gift you offer to life, without attachment, without expecting anything back. You can only give what is truly yours: a smile, a nod of encouragement, a gentle touch, and a kind word. This is not giving to others what you no longer want, like the sweater that no longer fits, but gifting that which is most precious-your authentic love and genuine feelings.

THE INVITATION
Make a list of 10 people and things for which you are grateful. Connect with the feeling of gratitude. The giveaway comes to ask you to feel the same gratitude without needing anything or anyone to inspire it, and to share this gratitude with those you meet.

As you offer thanks, your heart opens and you start realizing how much life has given you. You heal your feelings of scarcity and open yourself to the abundance that surrounds you. The giveaway invites you to be in the flow of life, as you give freely and receive freely.

THE MEDICINE
Is it difficult for you to set limits on how much of yourself you give? If you give more than is healthy, then you will not be able to give for long.

You’ll feel resentful with your partner or associates, or you’ll feel like the world owes you something in return.
Notice if you give for any reason other than pure generosity. Are you trying to be liked or accepted? Are you hoping to heal an old wound?

Start giving to yourself first and foremost. Offer yourself the care, the love, the time, and the acceptance that you are longing for. Once you experience plenty, then you can truly give to others.

Die Kleinsten sind die Größten ❤

Unser Tierheim hat eine unglaublich süße Spendenbox von den Kids des St. Thomas Kindergarten in Helmstedt bekommen. 

Neben zahlreichen leckeren Schmeckis für unsere Fellnasen konnten wir auch eine Dose entdecken. Die Kleinen haben selbst Pflanzen gezogen und ihren Eltern damit gegen eine Spende fürs Tierheim eine Freude bereitet. Eine großartige Idee und wir sind gerührt, dass auch die Kleinsten schon ein so großes Herz für Tiere haben! 🥰

Das gesamte Tierheim-Team und alle Bewohner bedanken sich bei euch! 🐾

Our pantry provides clients with much-needed items, and we need your help to keep the shelves full.

Please note the following items, which we will not accept:
• Perishable items requiring refrigeration, such as fresh produce and meats
• Expired items, or Items expiring within the next six (6) months
• Cans with dents, rust, or missing labels
• Jumbo size canned items meant for large groups (food is distributed to individual families, so these items may go to waste)
• Loose, bulk items, open items, or homemade food items

Not sure what you're able to get from this list? We also accept gift cards such as Gas Gift Cards, Grocery Store Gift Cards, any Visa Gift Cards, etc. These give clients the ability to get items they want and need that we can't or don't stock.

For the full list of items we need for our pantry, please click the link in our bio and click the "Ways to Give" tab. If you have any questions or would like to donate, please reach out to us at info@hopeworksofhc.org.
